loans.name: Miniru

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Miniru.  He is married and has two children aged three and six. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him to help a younger brother with his education.

In 2007, Miniru established his provisions, drinks and mobile phone recharge card business.  The business was started after dropping out of school, so as to be self-reliant. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are adults and passengers. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,214,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Miniru has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans and now requires a new loan in order to add to the stock and expand the trade on mobile phone recharge cards. He hopes that this loan will improve the business and add to the profit. In the future, Miniru plans to move from a wooden kiosk to a concrete shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions, drinks and recharge cards

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old married man. He and his wife are blessed with one child that he supports. 

To earn a living, he runs a motorcycle transport business, which he has operated for the last four years. He explains that he typically earns a monthly income of approximately 20,000 KES.  

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES from KADET, which he hopes to add to his savings so that he can purchase another motorcycle. By doing so, he expects to be able to expand his business and to increase his profits. 


The anticipated profits he expects to generate on account of the loan proceeds will be reinvested in his business for further expansion, while a portion of the anticipated profits will be used to help his wife start a shoe selling business. His future goals are to be successful in life and to educate his child.

loans.use: to buy  another motorcycle

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 49 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and four children in the small community of SKD Gbargbo Town in Paynesville South.  Her children are between the ages of six and 23 years and, while one of them stays with her at home, the other children are independent. 

Ophelia started out by selling cool water.  Because she was determined and focused, she now has a table where she sells bath soap, body cream, body spray, hair grease, hand wash and many other items. The profit that she generates from the business will be used to pay back her loan, pay for house rent, food, school fees and to buy more goods to improve her business.  With the loan given to her she will purchase more body cream, body spray, hand wash and hair grease to increase her sales.  She hopes to have a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, body spray, hand wash and hair grease.

loans.name: Erika Elizabeth

texts.es:
ERIKA ELIZABETH, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, hace seis años inició sus estudios  de agronomía motivada por sus padres ya que ellos cultivan diversas flores y uno de sus deseos de sus padres y que ella comparte es formar un biohuerto para lo cual aplicará todos los conocimientos obtenidos gracias a sus estudios.
Actualmente viene llevanado una maestría la cual esta por terminar pero le agradaría poder culminar sus estudios universitarios y finalizar la tesis de su titulación.
El ´préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago para la sustentación de la tesis de su carrera de agronomía.
texts.en:
Erika Elizabeth is 24 years old and single. Six years ago, she began her studies in agronomy, motivated by her parents since they cultivate a variety of flowers. One of her parents' desires, which she shares, is to form an organic garden where she will use all of the knowledge obtained thanks to her studies. 

Currently she is completing a masters program which is about to end, but she would like to finish her university studies and complete the thesis for her degree. 

The loan received will be invested in paying to support her thesis and her studies in agronomy.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in agronomy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soil and clay

loans.name: Centenario Group

texts.es:
José Manuel es un miembro del grupo Centenario el cual se encuentra ubicado un lugar donde hay una laguna la cual es la principal fuente de empleo para sus habitantes ya que se dedican a la pesca y venta de mojarra. Él tiene la edad de 24 años, solo estudio la preparatoria se encuentra soltero, José Manuel comenta que decidió  iniciar con su negocio porque desea apoyar a su familia con los gastos de su hogar ya que la situación el país es muy difícil y piensa que teniendo su propio negocio puede aspirar a tener un mejor bienestar económico. Él se encuentra muy feliz no solo por tener su negocio sino porque brida a su comunidad una servicio al tener sus abarrotes muy económicos y en buena calidad. José Manuel platica que la idea de tener su negocio nació desde hace 3 años ya que piensa que es un negocio que tiene un provenir ya que no hay temporadas siempre se vende, gracias a Dios ha ido muy bien y día a día tiene más clientes. Él invertirá este crédito en la compra de arroz, frijol, productos enlatados, dulces, refrescos, jugos, papas fritas, jabón de baño, detergentes, cloro, suavizante, cerillos, aceite, pan y aromatizantes para continuar con su negocio. José Manuel espera que en este futuro poder seguir ofreciendo a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Virginia venta de pescado, 
Carmen venta de pollo,
Emilia venta de ropa,
Ana venta de cosméticos,
Ofelia venta de pescado,
Maricela venta de abarrotes,
Perfecta venta de pescado,
Modesta venta de refresco,
Josefina venta de comida.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, canned goods, sweets, soft drinks, juices, chips, soap, detergent, bleach, fabric softener, oil, bread, and flavorings.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre. Vive junto a su conviviente Luís quien es profesor en una institución educativa, vive en compañía su hijo de 3 años al que quiere mucho y es su motivación para seguir esforzándose en salir adelante. La actividad que realiza Mónica es la venta de pescado, para esto cuenta con un pequeño puesto en el mercado informal de la ciudad, se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige al puerto de pescadores, donde compra su producto y lo lleva a su puesto de venta.  Es muy alegre en la atención de sus clientes quienes la visitan a diario, se ha sabido ganar su aprecio y cariño así mantiene una regular clientela. Lleva trabajando de esta manera hace más de 6 años, contando con la ayuda de su conviviente  en momentos que no esta trabajando. Considera rentable a su negocio ya que cuenta con una regular clientela que le compran sus productos a diario. Antes de dedicarse a este negocio tenia problemas económicos por esta situación decidió poner e implementar su propio negocio. Lo que le gusta  de  su actividad es que  le permite tener un ingreso económico con este dinero apoya en los gastos de su hogar, sus hijos es su motivación y la anima a seguir esforzándose por darle  una mejor calidad de vida.  Manifiesta que desea poder incrementar su capital de su negocio. por tanto éste será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad brindada, manifiesta que será puntual en sus pagos para poder acceder a más préstamos.
Con el monto solicitado de 700 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en su negocio, en la compra de pescado en mayor volumen buscando obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mónica is 41 years old and is a happy, hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Luis, who works as a teacher.  She has a three year old son, whom she loves very much as is her motivation for continuing ahead.

Mónica sells fish in the city’s informal market.  She gets up very early in the morning, goes to the place where the fishermen gather, buys her products, and takes them to her point of sale.  She is very happy when she tends her to customers and they visit her daily because she has won them over.

She has been working this way for more than six years and her husband helps her when she is not working.  She considers this to be a profitable business because her customers buy her products daily.  Before doing this, she had financial problems so she decided to start her own business.  What she likes is that this allows her to have an income and support her household expenses with this money.  Her son is her motivation to continue making an effort to give him a better quality of life.

She says that she wants to increase her working capital.  This will be her second loan through MFP.  She is happy for this opportunity and says that she’s happy about the opportunity and that she will make her payments on time.

She will invest the entire 700 PEN from this loan into fish in quantity so that she can have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Los Nuevos Group

texts.es: Alma tiene 25 años y  es originaria de la población  de Zitacuaro, ella es madre de dos niños los cuales estudian la primaria, es madre soltera es por eso que ella le echa muchas ganas para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella pertenece a un grupo llamado Los Nuevos, dice que entro al grupo para poder comprar una máquina de coser ya que tiene un taller de costura desde hace 7 años, dice que la necesidad por tener un trabajo estable fue que la llevo a que aprendiera a coser, dice que desde que iba en la secundaria le llamaba la atención el coser ya que iba en el taller de corte y confección y desde ahí empezó hacer sus primeras creaciones. Dice que ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material como sierres, tela de diferentes texturas y colores, hilos, agujas, etc. Ella hace pantalones, blusas, camisas, vestidos de noche, sabanas, cobijas y muchas creaciones mas, dice que irá a surtirse a la Ciudad de México donde le den más bajos precios para que le alcance a comprar todo el material que ocupa, dice que en el mes de diciembre es cuando mas trabajo tiene ya que las escuelas le mandan hacer los vestuarios para las pastorelas o los bailables. Dice que su meta es hacer un gran taller para darle a la gente de su población trabajo que es lo que mas falta hace para salir adelante. Las otras 7 personas se llaman J. Remedios, Citlaly, María Guadalupe, Hilda, Javier, Diana y Mayra ellos invertirán en florería para la compra de diferentes variedades para vender, frutas y legumbres de temporada para vender, en una papelería, cosméticos por catalogo y antojitos mexicanos para su venta.
texts.en:
Alma, 25, is from the town of Zitacuaro.  She's the mother of two elementary-school children.  She's a single mother, which is why she puts so much into getting her children ahead.

She belongs to a group called Los Nuevos.  She says she joined the group to be able to buy a sewing machine because she has had a tailor shop for seven years.  She says that needing to have a stable job led her to learn to sew.  Since she was in secondary school she was interested in sewing because she was in the dressmaking workshop.  From there she began to design her first creations.

She says that she's asking for a loan right now to buy material such as zippers, fabric in different textures and colors, thread, needles, etc.

She makes pants, blouses, shirts, nightgowns, sheets, blankets, and many other designs.  She's going to go to Mexico City to stock up because they have lower prices and she'll have enough money to buy all the materials she needs.  In the month of December she has more work because the schools order the costumes for the Pastorela [shepherd's pageant] or the dance shows.

She says her goal is to make a big workshop to give people in her town jobs, which is what is most needed to get ahead.  The other seven people are J. Remedios, Citlaly, María Guadalupe, Hilda, Javier, Diana, and  Mayra, and they're going to invest in different varieties to sell in a flower shop, seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell, a stationery store, cosmetics sales via catalogue, and Mexican snack sales.

loans.use: to buy zippers, fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Chojña Pampita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHOJÑA PAMPITA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de zanahorias, venta de cebollas, venta de habas, venta de arvejas, tienda de barrios, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Marcelina es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que se incorporó a la institución por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio de tienda de barrio, cuenta que este negocio lo comenzó después de haber tenido un negocio de venta de refrescos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su negocio (compra de fideo, aceite, enlatados) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “CHOJÑA PAMPITA” will be beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the Regional Office Patacamaya, it is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Marcelina is the president.

The businesses that the communal bank members participate in are varied. Included among them are the sales of carrots, onions, lima beans, and peas, as well as a neighborhood store and cattle sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses in different lines of work, and Marcelina's is an integral part. She states that this is the first time she has has joined the institution at the invitation from a promoter who went to visit her at her house.

Currently, she has a neighborhood store. She says she started this business after having had a business selling sodas. The loan that she is now requesting is to help her diversify her business by buying noodles, oil and canned goods that she will acquire from the distributors and later sell in her retail space. 

This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family where possible, since she is married. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health trainings and loans.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase machinery for a carpentry business

loans.name: Virginia Elizabeth

texts.es: Virginia es una señorita muy emprendedora tiene 18 años  de edad  vive con sus padres la Sra. Virginia y el Sr. Juan quienes la estan apoyando y motivando para que su pequeño negocio crezca y  pueda salir adelante actualmente esta estudiando la carrera de medicina  cuando es el dia que le toca ir a  la escula  sus padres la apoyan con el negocio ya que comentan sus padres que es una gran apoyo para motivarla y que  ella salga delante también con sus estudios que es lo más importante para que una persona logre todas sus metas y propósitos. Pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la inversión, Virginia necesita comprar  Licuadoras y mas productos nuevos que han salido para asi tener mas variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder atender con mas Rapidez ya que solo cuenta con 2 licuadoras y es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia is a very enterprising 18-year-old woman. She lives with her parents Virginia and Juan, who support and encourage her so that her business grows and she can get ahead. Currently, Virginia is studying medicine. Her parents help out with her business on the days she has to go to school. They encourage her to get ahead in school, so she has learned to prioritize her studies so that she will be able to pursue her goals.

At the moment, she does not have the money necessary to invest in her business.  Virginia needs to purchase blenders and more products for her business in order to have more variety for her clients and be able to attend to them quickly, because as of now she only has 2 blenders.  For this reason she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: invest in merchandise such as a blender.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, paint brushes, paint and other items to create artisan crafts.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA  est constitué de 3 femmes mariées et 2 veuves  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de vêtements, des habits et de la friperie.
FATOUMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la femme du milieu. Elle fait l’achat vente des friperies et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 colis de friperie avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Danaya consists of three married women and two widows who average 37 years of age and four children each. They live in traditional families in the district of Massablacoura, in the city of Bougouni. They know one another as neighbors, friends and colleagues. They sell second-hand clothes.

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to bolster their capital and better run their businesses. This is their second loan cycle with the MFI. 
Their first loan was correctly repaid.

Fatoumata, seen in the center, is the president of the group. She buys and sells used clothing. She will use her loan to buy three bales of used clothing from wholesalers in Bamako.  

She conducts her sales at the market and from her home, at retail, for cash or credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to invest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
El señor Alex tiene de 43 años de edad es soltero, vive en una comunidad ubicada en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene dos hijos a los cuales les apoya económicamente para su alimentación y educación.
Don Alex  se dedica desde hace 04 años  a su negocio de pulpería y sus clientes le prefieren por su variedad de productos.
Don Alex es un buen cliente y tiene deseos de salir adelante, Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, cosméticos, lácteos, jugos, pollo, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, agua, churros, galletas, jabón, etc.
El señor Alex invertirá el préstamo en su negocio para obtener ganancias que le permitan  salir adelante con sus hijos  y tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Don Alex su sueño es seguir trabajando para  prosperar en su negocio y también seguir  mejorando su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Alex, 43, is single and lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  He has two children whose food and education he supports financially.  Alex has had his grocery store business for four years, and his customers prefer him because of the variety of products.

Alex is a good client who wants to get ahead.  He's requesting the loan to buy soda, cosmetics, dairy products, juice, chicken, sugar, rice, beans, water, "churros" [fried dough snacks] cookies, soap, etc.  Alex will invest the loan in his business to earn profits that will allow him to get ahead with his children and have a greater variety of products to sell to his customers.

Alex's dream is to continue working to prosper in his business and to continue improving his house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2012

loans.use: to buy provisions for his store

loans.name: La Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
La Divina Misericordia es el nombre de un pequeño grupo integrado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras que desde hace algunos años realizan actividades económicas para ganar un poco de dinero extra y dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Trinidad tiene la edad de 41 años, es soltera y solo estudio la primaria, ella platica que su madre desde pequeña le aconsejo que aprendiera un oficio el cual le serviría en un futuro así que aprendió a tejer y actualmente se dedica a la venta de blusas y zapatos tejidos, ella esta contenta ya que gracias las manualidades que realiza puede tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya tiene realizando esta actividad 8 años y durante este tiempo ha ganado buenas clientes como ya la gente la conoce no tiene que salir a ofrecer sino que sus ellas la visitan para hacer sus pedidos de blusas y elegir sus modelos. Trinidad invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de hilos, listones, agujas y ganchos para la elaboración de sus manualidades. Ella espera a futuro continuar realizando sus ventas y ganar mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y hacer algunos arreglos a su hogar. Este grupo agradece a VisionFund por el apoyo que les ha brindado a través de este préstamo.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Denise venta de oro laminado
Martha venta de ropa
Domitila venta de refrescos
texts.en:
La Divina Misericordia is the name of a small group of 4 entrepreneurial women who have been engaged for a few years now in economic activities in order to earn a little extra money so as to give their families a better quality of life. 
Dona Trinidad, is 41 years old; she is single and only attended elementary school. From a very young age, she says her mother advised her to learn a trade that would be helpful to her in the future. Therefore, she learnt to weave and currently works selling woven blouses and shoes. She is happy, as her craft has enabled her to have a better quality of life. 
She has been involved in this activity for 8 years and during this time has gained good clients. Since people know about her, she doesn't have to go out to offer her handicraft; instead, her clients visit her, to choose their designs and order blouses. Trinidad will invest this loan to purchase an assortment of thread, yarn, needles and ribbon to use for her craft. She hopes to grow her sales in the future and to gain new clients, in order to increase her earnings and for small home improvements. 
This group wishes to thank VisionFund for the help it has offered them with this loan. The other members of the group are : Denise, who sells laminated gold items, Martha who sells clothes and Domitilla who sells refreshments.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of thread, yarn, ribbon and needles

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 55 años, es una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy responsable. Realiza sus actividades laborales junto a su conviviente Orlando quien se dedica a la soldadura, hace puertas ventanas de metal.  Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en la capital, pero el trabajo de María consiste en el armado de puertas, ventanas, escaleras de estructura metálica. Tiene un local en el frontis de su vivienda propia. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad económica y se inicio en este negocio porque su conviviente necesitaba un ayudante para pintar las estructuras de las puertas y ventanas. Como no conseguían un ayudante, ella se dedicó a pintar  y desde entonces decidieron trabajar juntos. Con su conviviente  salen a buscar clientes en distintos lugares donde requieran estos servicios. Comenta que este rubro le brinda muchas ganancias ya que la ciudad empieza  a crecer y hay más construcciones y necesitan de sus servicios en el área de carpintería metálica. Cada vez los lugares donde los requieren se hace mas distante a su hogar, por ello cuentan  con una movilidad para transportar sus herramientas de trabajo como su maquina soldadora,  su cortadora de fierro y otros implementos. Le va muy bien ya que cada vez tiene más clientes y eso le permite estar generando ingresos en cada momento. Espera posteriormente poder abrir un taller y así incrementar sus ganancias  para dar oportunidad de trabajo a otras personas. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, le gusta el grupo que forma parte ya que todos se conocen y siempre están al pendiente de lo que le pueda pasar a los otros.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, y comprará algunos materiales como  fierros, planchas de aluminio y  equipos que le hacen falta para su trabajo carpintería metálica.
texts.en:
María, 55, is an honest, hardworking, and above all very responsible woman.  She does her job along with her partner, Orlando, who makes a living as a welder making metal doors.  Her children are independent and live in the capital.  María's job is making doors, windows, and stairs of metal.  She has a place in the front of her own home.

She has done this work for eight years; she started because her partner needed a helper to paint the doors and windows.  She decided to do it because he couldn't get a helper, and since then they decided to work together.  They go out to look for customers in various places where these services are needed.  She comments that this field gives her a lot of profits because the city is beginning to grow and there's more construction and a need for their services in the area of metallic carpentry.  The places where they're needed are farther away all the time, so they have a way to transport their welding machine, metal cutter, and other work tools.

It's going very well for her because she has more customers all the time, which allows her to generate a regular income.  She hopes to be able to open a workshop later to increase her profits and give other people the opportunity to work.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She likes her group because everyone knows each other and they're always watching out for what could happen to the others.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles [PEN] she'll buy such materials as braces, sheets of aluminum, and equipment she needs for her job in metallic carpentry.

loans.use: to buy braces, sheets of aluminum, and equipment for metallic carpentry.

loans.name: Norma Dinora

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de embutidos, y hace un año decidió por dedicarse a la venta de comida. Elabora pollo frito con tajadas de banano verde y  esta comida la vende por encargos. De este negocio ella cubre la manutención de sus hijos. ya ha solicitado varios prestamos a ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es el sexto préstamo y es por 5,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar carne de pollo, bananos verdes, condimentos y otros insumos para la elaboración de comida y con una parte va comprar ropa para la venta para obtener otros ingresos.
Tiene como meta darles el estudio a sus hijos y lograr tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Norma, 36, is a single mother; she has two children and lives in a village belonging to the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  She’s always been a merchant.  She used to sell cured meats and a year ago decided to start selling food.  She makes fried chicken with green plantain slices that she sells on order.  She’s able to feed her children thanks to her business and she’s already asked ODEF for several loans.  The one she’s requesting now is her 6th and it’s for 5,000 Lempiras that she will use to buy chicken, green plantain, condiments and other ingredients needed to make the food; she will use part of it to buy clothes to sell in order to earn additional income.  Her goal is to provide schooling for her children and to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chicken, plantain, condiments, lard and to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joel Alfredo

texts.es:
Joel, se ha decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita dinero para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejas como lo es la tierra, zacate, leña, que son los insumos para fabricar este producto que es útil para la construcción de techos.
El comenta que con el préstamo anterior, tuvo una experiencia positiva ayudándole a mejorar sus ventas a los clientes, con esto recibió ganancias que han sido invertidas en la familia y en el mismo negocio.
texts.en: Joel has decided to take out a new loan because he needs money to buy raw materials like clay, grass and firewood to manufacture roofing tiles which are the ingredients needed to make this product which is useful for building roofs.  He comments that he had a positive experience with the previous loan; it helped him improve his sales to customers and this led to profits that have been invested in the family and in the business itself.

loans.use: to buy soil, grass and wood.

loans.name: Tito Esau

texts.es:
Tito, quiere aprovechar la temporada navideña para aumentar la elaboración de desinfectantes y para la sastrería, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar materiales para preparar los desinfectantes y tambien la compra de telas para elaborar prendas de vestir como faldas y pantalones.
Él manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a su negocio ya que con la inversión realizada ha logrado mantenerse ocupado, con ello ha generado los ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Tito wants to make the most of the Christmas season to increase his production of disinfectant and his tailoring.  This is why he's requesting another loan to buy materials to make disinfectant and also to buy fabric to make garments such as skirts and pants.

He says the previous loan helped him in his business because with the investment he has managed to keep himself busy, with which he has earned the income for his household.

loans.use: to buy fabric for tailoring and materials to make disinfectant

loans.name: David Ernesto

texts.es:
David, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura, solo él trabaja en la familia, esta ocupación surgió por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario específico, ya tiene varios años de experiencia.
Actualmente está realizando la siembra de granos básicos, solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono e insecticidas, que son los necesarios en el proceso de siembra, la compra le permitirá tener lo recursos para realizar el trabajo.
Su aspiración es tener un cultivo bastante establecido, poder comercializar la cosecha, con el objetivo de obtener mejores condiciones para la familia.
texts.en: David lives with his wife and two children.  He works in agriculture.  He’s the only one in the family that works.  His occupation arose from his own initiative.  He does not have a fixed work schedule and has several years’ experience.  He’s currently growing basic grains and is requesting a loan to buy manure and insecticide that are necessary for the planting process; the purchase will make it possible for him to have resources to do the work.  His hope is to have a well-established crop and to be able to sell the harvest in order to attain better conditions for the family.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Las Bugambilias Group

texts.es:
Las Bugambilias es un grupo integrado por 14 personas, esta ubicado en la comunidad de Monte Alto en el cual la principal actividad economica es la siembra de caña de azucar y la recoleccion de la resinas de árbol de hule.

Paula es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene 21 años, estudio la secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Federico los cuales tienen 2 hijos. Paola comenta que su madre le enseño a trabajar  el campo desde muy pequeña y hacer luchar con su familia, ahora que tiene hijos debe de trabajar aun mas para ganar un poco mas de dinero y darles una mejor oportunidad de vida.
Ella se encuentra muy feliz por tener su siembra de caña a ella le gusta mucho hacerlo pues dia a dia aprende mas de esa labor. Paola comenta que desde hace 4 años se dedia a este negocio  y que gracias  a Dios las cosechas han salido muy bien y a la ayuda de sus trabajadores ha sacado adelante sus cosechas.
Ella ocupara esta inversion para la compra de fertiliantes, pagar a sus trabajadores, riego y cuidado de su cosecha para sacar adelante a su negocio y poder seguir adelante con la siembra. Paola espera que en un futuro pueda ofrecerle a sus hijos una carrera.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Maria de Lourdes venta de gasolina,
Cedonia veta de refresco,
Martha venta de calzado,
Veronica venta de calzado, 
Maria sembrado de caña,
Santa Maria venta de abarrotes,
Oscar siembra de caña,
Maria de los Angeles venta de fertilizantes,
Jose Francisco venta de abarrotes,
Eulogio venta de refresco,
Jeronimo  venta de fertilizantes,
Jose Alfredo siembra de caña,
Norma venta de carne.
texts.en:
“Las Bugambilias” is a group of 14 people located in the community of Monte Alto; the community’s main economic activity is planting sugarcane and collecting rubber tree resins.    Paula is one of the group members.  She’s 21-years-old and attended secondary school.  She’s married to Federico and they have two children.  Paula comments that her mother taught her to work in the fields when she was very little and to strive for her family.  Now she has two children and must work even more to earn a little more money and give them a better life opportunity.

She’s very happy because she has her sugarcane field planted and she enjoys doing it very much because she learns more about this work every day.  Paula comments that she’s been in this business for four years and thanks to God her crop yields have been very good and with help from her workers she’s moved her crops forward.  She will use this investment to buy fertilizer and to pay her laborers; to irrigate and care for her crop to move her business forward and be able to continue moving ahead with her crop.  Paula hopes in future to offer her children a career.

The other group members are:

María de Lourdes -gasoline sales
Cedonia -soft drink sales
Martha -shoe sales
Verónica -shoe sales
María -sugarcane growing
Santa María -grocery sales
Oscar -sugarcane growing
María de los Ángeles -fertilizer sales
José Francisco -grocery sales
Eulogio -soft-drink sales
Jerónimo -fertilizer sales
José Alfredo -sugarcane growing
Norma -meat sales

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: La Conchita Group

texts.es: El grupo "La Conchita" se encuentra ubicada en una comunidad donde la mayoria de sus habitantes son comerciantes y se conocen unos a otros. Los integrantes del grupo comentan que la plaza mas grande se realiza todos los dias miercoles. Son cuatro integrantes todos son familiares. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque en la comunidad festejan a la imagen de la Purisima Concepcion. Don Alberto quien es el representante del grupo platica que tiene 62 años de edad esta casado con la señora Macaria juntos formaron una familia con hijos de los cuales y solo tienen una hija que depende de ellos, hija se encuentra estudiando la Universidad la carrera de arquitectura. Don alberto tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 17 años la inicio porque de alguna manera deseaba que su familia tuviera una mejor caliadad de vida, Don Alberto Platico "La inicie solo poniendo algunas cajas de madera y mis productos solo las adquiria por docenas sin embargo poco a poco han ido creciendo" Don Alberto esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas leche, huevo, harina, refrescos, aceites, etc. don Alberto platica que no presenta ninguna dificultad para vender y que cada vez que sus clientes llegan a su negocio los trata con amabilidad para que regresen con confianza de querer comprar, Don Alberto y el resto de su familia esta muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund y Kiva por el credito otorgado ya que podran invertir en sus actividades economicas como Doña Macaria invertira en la venta de plasticos, Hugo invertira en alimento y forraje para el ganado y Araceli invertira en su venta de ropa. Cada uno de ellos tienen metas en sus negocios Don Alberto lo que mas desea es que su hija llegue a termianar su carrera profesional y pueda ejercerla de alguna manera.
texts.en:
The “La Conchita” (The Little Shell) group is located in a community where most of the residents are merchants and know one another.  The members of the group relate that the biggest market day takes place every Wednesday.  The group has four members; they are all related to each other.  They chose the group name because the “Purísima Concepción” (Immaculate Conception) is the community’s patron saint.  The group representative is Alberto, 62.  He’s married to Macaria and they formed a family with children but only one daughter is still dependent on them; she’s attending the university studying Architecture.  Alberto has had a grocery store for 17 years; he started it because he wanted his family to somehow have a better quality of life.  Alberto related: “I started it by just putting a few wooden crates out and I’d only get my products by the dozen.  However, little by little they’ve been growing.”  


Alberto is requesting a loan to buy more milk, eggs, flour, soft-drinks, oil, etc.  He relates that he has no particular difficulty selling and every time his customers show up at his store he treats them with kindness so that they’ll return with confidence and want to buy.  Alberto and the rest of his family are very happy and grateful to VisionFund and Kiiva for the granted loan because they will be able to invest in their economic activities.


Macaria will invest in plastic sales, Hugo will invest in feed and forage for the cattle and Araceli will invest in her clothing sales.  Each one of them has business goals.  What Alberto most wants is that his daughter finishes her professional career and that she will be able to practice it somehow.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

location.town: La Concepcion de los Baños, Ixtlahuaca

loans.name: Loma Chiquita Group

texts.es: El grupo “Loma Chiquita” está compuesto por tres mujeres y un hombre, integrantes que son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras con sus actividades. Platican que le pusieron así a su grupo porque viven en una lomita chiquita, anteriormente tenían el nombre de loma bonita pero decidieron cambiarlo. María de la Luz quien es uno de los miembros tiene 23 años de edad vive en unión libre con Juan Manuel quien trabaja de albañil juntos han formado una familia con dos niños. Luz, como de cariño de dicen, es una mujer muy joven pero con muchas ganas de querer sobresalir en la vida. Luz se dedica a la venta de dulces y vende todos los días afuera de su casa en una mesita; desde hace 2 años inicio su negocio porque quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida, esta vez está solicitando el crédito a la institución para poder comprar más dulces de diferentes tipos. Su dificultad es la falta de dinero para poder invertirle a su negocio pero gracias al préstamo que le otorgaran podrá comprar más dulces. El sueño de Luz es llegar a tener una tienda mas grande donde pueda vender todo tipo de productos, sus ganancias serán de gran ayuda para poder mejorar su calidad de vida también con sus ganancias podrá apoyar a sus hijos que desean estudiar. Los integrantes del grupo son Don José quien invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes, Catalina invertirá en dulces, y Doña Isidra comprara borregos para su cría y venta. El grupo está muy agradecido con Kiva y Vision Found por el crédito otorgado porque gracias a estos créditos han podido crecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Loma Chiquita” (Little Hill) group comprises three women and one man, members who are very hardworking, enterprising people with activities of their own.  They relate that they named their group thus because they live on a small hill; it used to be called “loma bonita” (pretty hill) but they decided to change it.  

María de la Luz, 23, is one of the group members.  She lives in free union with Juan Manuel who works in construction.  They have formed a family together; they have two children.  Luz, as she’s affectionately called, is a very young woman but she very much wants to get ahead in life.  Luz works selling candy every day on a little table outside her house.  She started the business two years ago because she wanted to help her husband with household expenses so they could have a better quality of life.  This time, she’s asking the institution for a loan to buy more candy of various types.  Her difficulty is the lack of money to invest in the business but thanks to the loan she’ll be granted she will be able to buy more candy.

Luz’s dream is to have a larger store where she can sell all types of products.  Her profits will be of great use to her to be able to improve her quality of life and she will also be able to use her profits so that her children can go to school.  

The other group members are José who will invest in his grocery store, Catalina who will invest in candy and Isidra who will buy sheep to raise and then sell.  The group is very grateful to Kiva and VisionFund for the granted loan because thanks to the loans they’ve been able to make their business grow.

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a Peruvian artisan who creates handcrafted silver jewelry. Carmen hopes to stock up on the materials she uses in her jewelry, such as silver and gemstones, so she can increase production.

Carmen has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

"It was through jewelry that I met my husband. He taught me so much, and is still by my side, helping me perfect my work and giving me his total support. I find a great deal of satisfaction in my work. For me, my art is a fusion of fantasy and reality. My artistic name is Zilhi, in honor of our daughter, and it means 'Star.' Now we both use this artistic name, as our art is also born from our union.

"I am so grateful to you who are giving us a hand with this microcredit, because you are permitting the development of our wonderful jewelry art. This craft provides us with an income for our families and also contributes to the development of our society. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Carmen's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6738

loans.use: to stock up on the materials she uses in her jewelry, such as silver and gemstones, so she can increase production.

loans.name: Ericka Lucrecia

texts.es:
Ericka 24 años de edad, es originaria de Teustepe, casada, de oficio comerciante, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad. Ella es dueña de una  pulpería de la que es propietaria hace más de 15 años. Ella dice que su marido tiene un taller de reparación de llantas, ya que el le ayuda con el gasto de la casa. Sus expectativas es seguir creciendo para agregar mas producto a inventario y asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Ericka esta solicitando el  crédito para comprar mas gaseosas, pan y jugos para reforzar un poco mas la pulpería. Ya que ella estima que  el crédito le ayudara a  invertir mas  en su negocio, de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias,  su meta próxima es  iniciar una venta de comida, lo cual lo tiene provisto iniciarlo en enero del año 2013 con la ayuda de su marido.
texts.en:
Ericka is 24 years old, originally from Teustepe, married, and has two children ages 9 and 5. She works as a merchant and is the owner of a small grocery store that she has had for more than 15 years. She says that her husband has a tire repair garage, so he helps her with household expenses. Her expectation is to keep growing to add more products to her inventory and thus be able to satisfy her customers' needs.

Ericka is asking for the loan to buy more sodas, bread and juices to strengthen the grocery store a bit more. As she estimates that the loan will help her to invest more in her business, thus earning a better income, her next goal is to start selling prepared food, which is projected to begin in January of the year 2013 with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to buy more soda, bread and juices.

loans.name: Machacamarca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHACAMARCA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hermenigilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de papa, chuño, producción de leche, venta de refrescos y cerveza, venta de queso, .

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Hermenigilda es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que se incorporó a la institución por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio de venta de refrescos, cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, ya que en su madre realizaba lo mismo, posteriormente ella decidió realizar este comercio en las comunidades aledañas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su negocio (compra de cerveza) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercialaza4rá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Machacamarca” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Hermenigilda.  The members carry out a variety of business activities among which are potato growing, dehydrated potatoes, milk production, soft-drink and beer sales, and cheese sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen with various lines of work.  Hermenigilda is one of the members and she indicates that this is the first time she’s joined the institution having been invited to do so by a promoter who visited her at home.  She currently sells soft-drinks.  She comments that she learned this business when she was a girl since her mother did the same thing and she later decided to do this commerce in adjacent communities.

The loan she’ll take out now is to diversify her business.  She will buy beer from suppliers and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria  es una mujer  muy trabajadora que desde hace mas de tres años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada y  zapatos  para poder salir adelante y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar, esta casada con el Sr. Santana de 40 años que actualmente esta trabajando en una Bodega  pequeña que se dedican a la compra y venta de cartón y aluminio pero el sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos , tiene a  su hija Neidaly de 10 años de edad que esta cursando el  5to.año de primaria, la Sra.  no solo se dedica a vender la ropa tiene un sueldo extra que son dos dias a la semana haciendo el aseo en casa particular. por tal motivo solicita un crédito para pintar su casa y comprar más ropa.  En este mes de Diciembre hay un poco mas de Ventas pero sus clientes le están solicitando más variedad de ropa.
texts.en: Maria is a very hardworking woman who for more than three years has earned her living buying and selling used shoes and clothings so she can be successful and cover household expenses.  She's married to Santana, forty, who currently works for a small cardboard and aluminum vendor, but the income isn't sufficient to cover costs.  They have a daughter, Neidaly, ten-years-old, who is in fifth grade.  In addition to selling clothing, Maria makes extra income cleaning a home twice a week.  So, she's seeking a loan to paint her house and to buy more clothing to sell.  In the month of December sales go up, but her clients are asking for more variety in the clothing she sells.

loans.use: to paint the outside of her house and to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su hijo y nietos ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas de arroz y maíz, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, la pupusería esta ubicada en un lugar que califico como bueno para su trabajo ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque vende las pupusas mas ricas y calientitas de la zona además tiene los mejores precios, y el servicio mas rápido; María es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de su familia, la casa necesita reparaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad en su hogar, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital  por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, tejas, herramientas etc. María Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y  a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Margarita is 49 years old and lives with her son and grandchildren.  She sells “pupusas” made with rice and corn.  María has several years of experience in this business, which has given her the opportunity to generate more income.  Her “pupusa” shop is located in what is considered to be a good place.  She has many customers who prefer to do business with her because the “pupusas” she sells are delicious and served warm.  In addition, she offers affordable prices and very quick service.  

María is a woman who is dedicated to her work.  She is willing to do everything she can to fulfill her dreams since her family is the most important part of her life.  In recent weeks, the deteriorated condition of her home has made her family uncomfortable.  Her house is in need of repairs that need to be completed as quickly as possible to make it more secure.  María says that her greatest secret is that perseverance has allowed her to become successful.  She needs to invest in her home, but she does not have sufficient capital.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy cement, bricks, tiles, tools, and other materials.

María Margarita has good credit references and has been responsible in repaying her debts.  She has faith that she can provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, tiles, tools, and other materials.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Benito es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser honesto, y muy emprendedor en sus labores diarias, vive con su familia su esposa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en sus labores diarias. Actualmente tiene un granja de pollos, es decir el los cría y cuando ya sienten que esta grandes los vende, a su vez posee una pequeña parcela de insumos básicos de maíz y frijoles  todo esto para ganarse la vida honradamente y que en su hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día. Benito desea comprar insumos para tener bien a sus pollos y alimentarlos para que engorden y así el sabe que obtendrá ganancias es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y comprar concentrado para engorde cabe destacar que el cliente tiene excelentes muestras de pago ya que le gusta no deberle nada a nadie y saldar sus deudas espero recibir la ayuda y confía en Dios que pronto su situación mejorara.
texts.en:
Benito is a hardworking, enterprising man known for his honesty in his daily chores.  He lives with his wife and children who help him with his daily tasks.  He has a chicken farm, in other words he raises them and sells them when they are full size.  He also has a small plot of land for basic supplies, such as corn and beans, all with which to earn an honest living and ensure that he can feed his family.

Benito wants to buy supplies to care for his chickens and feed them so that they will fatten up, so he approached INTEGRAL to request a loan to buy concentrated feed.  He has a good payment record because he doesn’t like to be in debt.  He hopes to get help and trusts in God that things will soon get better.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Maria Cleofes

texts.es: Maria de 47 Años vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa humilde pero propia. Es una buena mujer que su mayor ilusión ha sido entregarlo todo por sus hijos y que estos el día de mañana e agradezcan su amor y sacrificio, es muy amable, honesta, y trabajadora con lo que mas le gusta hacer es muy conocida por trabajadora por sus vecinos cercanos. Gracias a Dios Maria es una mujer con muchas capacidades las cuales la hacen ver como una gran mujer actualmente posee un pequeño terreno donde siembra insumos básicos y luego los dispone a la venta lastimosamente por el tiempo que esta pasando en nuestro país ha tenido bajas en la cosecha y necesita los insumos para regenerar las mismas, es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un  crédito y así comprar insumos básicos como : semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos entre otros. Espera que pronto su ayuda tenga respuesta y agradece a DIOS todo poderoso por gran bendición que recibirá.
texts.en: Maria, 47 years old, lives with her husband and their children in a house which is humble, but their own. She is a good woman whose biggest hope has been to give everything to her children and that she will be able to this in the future and that they will be grateful for her love and sacrifice. She is very likable, honest and hardworking at what she likes to do best. She is very well-known as hardworking by her neighbors nearby. Thanks to God, Maria is a woman with many abilities which make her appear as a great woman. Currently she has a small plot of land where she plants basic supplies and later puts them on sale. Unfortunately because of the weather in our country she has had a drop in her harvest and she needs supplies to regenerate more. Because of this she went to INTEGRAL to request credit and that way she could buy basic supplies like seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and manure among others. She hopes that she will soon have their response and help and she thanks God all powerful for the great blessing that they will receive.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies like: seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and manure among others.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y arroz y al mismo tiempo a la crianza de ganado tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se siente orgulloso porque ha logrado obtener mucha experiencia que le permitirá día con día mejorar sus cosechas, las tierras de cultivo son propias y están ubicadas en una zona muy agrícola, el recibe todo el apoyo de su familia ellos le ayudan a comerciar en todos los lugares aledaños ya tiene mucha clientela pues la gente lo prefiere por la calidad del producto por los buenos precios y por el buen servicio; Manuel es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor siempre esta con las ganas de superarse y llegar al éxito,  la temporada pasada tuvo pérdidas y no logró las ganancias esperadas, por eso para esta siembra quiere aumentar la producción y recuperarse pero necesita de capital que lo respalde porque todas sus compras son al contado, es así como decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, arroz, fertilizante, herramientas, ganado etc. Manuel Antonio es responsable con buenas referencias crediticias tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio lives with his life partner and children.  He raises corn, beans, and rice, and raises livestock at the same time.  He’s been involved in agriculture for many years and is proud of it because he has been able to gain much experience which allows him to improve his harvests.  He owns his farmland and it’s located in a very agricultural zone.  His family helps him sell in many of the surrounding areas and he has many customers who prefer to buy from him because of the quality of the products, good prices, and good service.

Manuel is an enterprising man, dedicated to his work, with a desire to succeed.  He had some losses the previous season and did not get his expected income, so he wants to increase his production this season so that he can recover.  He doesn’t have the necessary capital and he must make all purchases in cash, so he has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy corn, bean, and rice seeds, fertilizer, tools, livestock, etc.  Manuel Antonio is very responsible and has good credit references.  He is certain that he will be able to repay the loan and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de superación y con muchas posibilidades de hacer algo grande con su vida, su mayor deseo es entregarle un mejor futuro a su familia buscando tener nuevos horizontes y olvidándose de la delincuencia que los rodea. Tiene un grupo familiar por el cual se esfuerza día a día, es muy trabajador y desde hace un tiempo se dedica a la venta de gas propano, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este trabajo y se siente orgulloso porque ha logrado que le dé buenos resultados,  su negocio es muy conocido y ya tiene mucha clientela en un lugar que identifico como muy bueno para desarrollar sus actividades; su meta es tener mejores beneficios que le ayuden a cumplir sus sueños. Él tiene la convicción de que si aumenta sus ventas así aumentarán las ganancias, es por eso que se acercó a solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar gas propano. Agradece la colaboración que recibirá además tiene esperanza en Dios que no lo abandonará para ya no verse influenciado por malas compañías y estar siempre ocupado en obras buenas como ésta, para así velar de la mejor manera por su familia y ser ejemplo correcto para ellos
texts.en: He is an enterprising man with a desire to succeed and with many possibilities to do something grand with his life.  His greatest desire is to provide a better future for his family, search for new horizons, and forget about the crime that surrounds him.  He makes a daily effort for his family and is a hardworking man who has been selling propane gas for several years.  He is proud because he has had good results, his business is very well known, is in a good location, and he has many customers.  His goal is to have better benefits so that he can achieve his dreams.  He has the conviction that is he increases his sales he will increase his income.  He is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy propane gas.  He is grateful for the cooperation he receives and has hopes that God will not abandon him and so that he will not end up in bad company and always do good work such as this.  He wants to better care for his family and be an example to them.

loans.use: to buy propane gas.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo de 41 años es una persona con mucha experiencia en el trabajo que realiza, haciendo que las personas lo prefieran ya que es responsable y cumplidor con sus pedidos. Rodolfo vive junto a su esposa e hijos, por quienes trabaja muy duro para que no les falte nada en el hogar. Él trabaja criando cerdos y ganado vacuno y así mismo cosecha maíz y maicillo el cual comercializa con diferentes clientes en mercados. Su negocio es bastante estable y su demanda se esta incrementando  razón por la que Rodolfo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder incrementar la cantidad de cerdos y vacas que posee y así mismo comprar alimento especial para ellos, vitaminas y darles todos los cuidados veterinarios que necesitan para brindar un mejor servicio y asegurarse siempre la preferencia de las personas.
texts.en: Rodolfo, who is 41 years old, is a person with much experience in his work, so people prefer him, since he is responsible and fulfills his orders. Rodolfo lives with his wife and children, for whom he works very hard so that nothing is lacking in his household. He raises pigs and cattle, and at the same time he harvests corn and sorghum, which he sells in the markets to various customers. His business is quite stable and his demand is increasing. For this reason, Rodolfo is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to increase the quantity of pigs and cows that he has and at the same time to buy special food and vitamins for them and to give them all the veterinary care that they need, so that he can offer better service and always be sure of the preference of his customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cattle

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan’s father was a town sheriff and is his inspiration to help people feel secure and meet their specific security needs. Jonathan’s business, All American Surveillance, was born seven years ago. The company focuses on the sale and installation of surveillance cameras and systems for private and commercial clients such as office buildings, neighborhoods and private homes. Jonathan currently employs two individuals who help him with installations, trouble shooting and design. Jonathan believes that the tools he offers make a big difference in helping business and residential owners feel protected. He is proud to have helped the local police solve robberies and theft cases through his equipment. Jonathan’s goal is to expand his business and provide reliable surveillance service and software to create a secure environment in his community. This loan will allow Jonathan to purchase new and enhanced equipment and to start a marketing campaign to bring in new clients. Help Jonathan to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase enhanced security equipment

loans.name: Marcus Vinicius

texts.en:
Marcus came from Brazil with his wife and daughter around 13 years ago. While he was working in construction, he started cleaning pools on his days off for extra money. That is what inspired him to start his own business, Lyons Pool Services. He is now fully dedicated to pool cleaning and has been the owner of the business for nine years. He provides weekly cleaning services and maintenance to residential and private pools. If necessary, he also adds chlorine and treats the water to avoid mold and to reduce bacteria. He is currently managing around 90 pools each month. 

His goal is to grow the company by acquiring more contracts and to be able to hire employees to help him. His motivation for his hard work is providing for his family and helping his daughter with college tuition. Marcus is asking for a loan to purchase new equipment.  With new equipment Marcus will be able to employ a greater number of staff therefore increasing the number of contracts that he is able to handle each month. Help Marcus grow his business and start generating new jobs!

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his pool cleaning business

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es:
ALBA LORENA
LA SEÑORA ALBA LORENA ES UNA PERSONA BIEN TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE  YA HA TENIDO OTROS CREDITOS EN FAPE Y HA PAGADO PUNTUALMENTE, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA TORTILLERIA Y VENTA DE COSMETICOS DE BELLEZA SU NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION Y POR DAR UN BUEN SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES LLEGA MUCHA GENTE A COMPRAR. ELLA AGRADECE A FAPE Y KIVA LA AYUDA QUE LE HAN BRINDADO Y DESEA SEGUIRSE SUPERANDO YA QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE UN PEQUEÑO NIÑO EL CUAL ELLA LO MANTIENE Y SU SUEÑO ES SEGUIR CRECIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO PARA BRINDARLE A SU NIÑO TODO LO MEJOR, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CRÉDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE COSMETICOS Y COMPRA DE MAIZ PARA LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS.
texts.en:
Alba Lorena is a very hardworking and responsible person who already has had other loans with Fape and has paid punctually.  She makes a living making tortillas and selling beauty cosmetics.  Her business is located in her home and for giving good service to her customers many people come to buy from her.  

She is grateful to Fape and Kiva for the help that they have provided for her and she wants to continue to improve as she is a single mother and has a small son who she supports.  Her dream is to continue growing in her business in order to provide all the best for her son.  

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cosmetics and also for the purchase of corn for the making and selling of tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and to purchase corn for the making and selling of tortillas.

loans.name: Dúo Elim Group

texts.es:
DÚO ELIM
Este dúo lo forma la señora Marta Olivia y la señora Lidia Del Rosario.  Lidia Del Rosario tiene 2 hijos y son casados vende yinas, (para dama y caballeros y niños) también zapatos y ropa para niños y playeras, gracais a dios le ha ido bien ahora que se aproxima la época navideña ella quiere aumentar sus ingresos surtiendo su negocio con nueva numeración de calzado, y además vender juguetes para niños ya que es la temporada y espera que se le pueda apoyar ya que son los únicos meses en que las ventas incrementan ya que en enero ella quiere empezar a vender ropa y uniformes para los niños que empiezan ir a la escuela.
texts.en: Dúo Elim is composed of Marta Olivia and Lidia del Rosario. Lidia del Rosario has told us that she has 2 children who are already married. She sells flip-flops for men, women and children, as well as shoes, children’s clothes and T-shirts. She thanks God because things have been going well so far, and as the Christmas season is approaching she wants to increase her earnings by supplying her shop with new shoes sizes, on top of selling toys for children, being this in tune with the season. She hopes to receive support because these are the only months where she can increase her sales; next January she wants to start selling clothes and uniforms for children who start going to school for the first time.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Dúo Jerico Group

texts.es:
DUO  JERICO
Este dúo lo forman doña Ana Patricia de 27 años de edad, ella es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, ella es dueña de una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace 4 años y esta solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en su tienda ya que es una muy buena temporada para surtirla porque es pequeña y no tiene suficientes productos para vender, entonses está solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
“Jerico” (Jericho) Duo

Ana Patricia, 27, is part of this duo.  She’s married and has three children.  She has owned a small store located at home for four years and she needs this loan to invest in the store because it’s a good season to have it well-stocked and since it’s small she does not have enough products to sell so she’s asking for this loan to buy basic staple food items.

loans.use: to buy basic staple food items.

loans.name: Rosa Emelinda

texts.es: Rosa Emelinda  de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida José y sus hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, además para complementar los gastos del hogar vende tortillas, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Rosa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Rosa Emelinda tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Emelinda is 47 years old and lives with her life companion José and their children.  She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items.  In addition, she sells tortillas as a way of supplementing the household expenses.  Rosa has been in business for many years and has gained the sales experience that allows her to generate more income.  Her store is in her home, which is situated in a very busy location.  Rosa has acquired many customers who prefer to do business with her because they are always in need of quality products at affordable prices.  Her service is unequaled since she always makes her customers a priority.  Rosa’s greatest secret behind her success is her consistency and her love for her work.  She knows this is the only way to achieve what she wants.  

Like any good merchant, she wants to increase her business by making a new investment.   Rosa Emelinda is in need of capital, so she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy basic grains, snack foods, eggs, bread, beverages, and other products.  She has good credit references and is confident that she can repay this debt.  At the same time, she believes she can provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snack foods, eggs, bread, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Hombre emprendedor, su mayor deseo es ganarse un futuro mas próspero a partir de encontrar nuevos horizontes, olvidándose de la delincuencia. Tiene un grupo familiar por el cual se esmera día a día, es muy trabajador y desde hace un tiempo se dedica a transportar personas en su mototaxi, medio de transporte muy utilizado desde su reciente relativa aparición en el país, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y se siente orgulloso porque ha logrado que le dé buenos resultados, tiene mucha clientela, sus actividades las realiza en diferentes puntos de la localidad donde reside; con los ingresos obtenidos le brinda el pan de cada día a su pequeña familia. Él tiene la convicción de que si le da el mantenimiento necesario a su medio de transporte su clientela estará satisfecha con el servicio que reciban, es por eso solicita un crédito que le permita  darle mantenimiento al mototaxi y comprar pintura, llantas entre otros. Agradece la colaboración que recibirá y confía en Dios que nunca lo abandonará para nunca verse influenciado por malas compañías y estar siempre ocupado en obras buenas como éstas y así velar de la mejor manera por su familia y ser ejemplo correcto para ellos.
texts.en: An enterprising man whose greatest desire is to earn more prosperous future by means of finding new horizons leaving behind the crime.  He has a family group he strives for day to day.  He’s very hardworking and for some time now has been working transporting people in his moto taxi, a form a transportation that has recently become popular in his country.  He’s been doing this for several years and feels proud because he’s managed to get good results; he has a large clientele and he does his activities in various spots in the place where he lives.  With income earned he provides daily bread for his small family.  He’s convinced that if keeps up the necessary maintenance for his taxi, his clients will be satisfied with the service they receive, which is why he is requesting a loan to service his vehicle, to buy paint and to buy tires, among others.  He is grateful for the collaboration he’ll receive and trusts that God will never abandon him so that he will never be influenced by bad companions and he’ll always stay busy doing good things like these and thus watch over his family in the best possible way and be a good example for them.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle, buy paint and tires.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a distributor of granite, marble, onyx, and other natural stones in Columbia, South Caroline. Joshua is a true expert and enthusiast of natural stones. He considers them “amazing creations of nature” with very real and practical use. He started his business nine months ago after he realized there was no other distributor in the city. Although Columbia is a small college town, there are many fabricators in the area excited to have a local distributor. He offers imported quality products at a good location for potential clients in the area, which has made fast growth of his company possible. The marble and other natural stones he sells are brought from Brazil, India, Nepali and Italy. Joshua’s only current employee is his brother, but he is hoping to hire one more person. Joshua enjoys the interaction with clients and helping them fill their needs. His business motto is “being the best, offering the best and demanding the best.”  Joshua is asking for a loan to purchase warehouse equipment necessary to move and secure stones in safe and efficient ways. This will allow him to increase his inventory and cash flow. He will also use the funds to hire a new employee.  Please help Joshua to grow his business!

loans.use: To hire a new employee and to purchase warehouse equipment

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar first came from Venezuela eight years ago. Looking to be independent and have his own business, he started Emicars Mobile Car Wash, a home-based business that has been in operation for over four years. The business focuses on the cleaning and interior detailing of all type of cars. Cesar is fully dedicated to his business and he currently works by himself. He runs his operation out of a van that stores all of his car washing equipment and products, and travels to visit clients. Cesar is requesting a loan to purchase a pressure washer, generator, and vacuum. This equipment will help him replace old equipment and provide better service. Cesar wants to grow his business and be able to get more clients to achieve financial stability for his wife and daughters. Help support a home-based business that is looking to expand into a start-up business. Cesar has big dreams of owning his own car washing businesses.  Help Cesar get closer to this dream.

loans.use: to purchase a pressure washer, generator, and vacuum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Mirador” es un grupo ya había trabajado anteriormente con la institución solo había más integrantes y se reunían cada vez que realizaban sus pagos. Esta vez son menos personas, pero todos son muy responsables. El nombre lo eligieron las mismas personas que conforman el grupo, se decidieron por este nombre porque todos conocen un rancho llamado "El Mirador". Doña Julia, quien es la representante del grupo, tiene 41 años de edad está casada con el señor Valentín desde hace 22 años y juntos han formado una familia con dos niños de los cuales uno se encuentra estudiando. Doña Julia se dedica a la elaboración de bordados como servilletas, tejidos, puntas para fondos, etc. desde hace 14 años. Doña Julia comentó “Inicié mi actividad porque mis hijos fueron mi motivación ya que ellos se encontraban estudiando, muchas veces no alcanzaba el dinero para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar yo tuve que aprender sola, además porque mi mamá también bordaba”. Su única dificultad es la falta de material ya que cuando tiene pedidos para entregar le hace falta dinero pero gracias al crédito que le otorgará la institución podrá entregar sus bordados a tiempo. La meta de Doña Julia es que su hijo termine su carrera profesional y pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las integrantes son Antonia, Marcelina, Julia, quienes también se dedican al bordado, ellas comentan que en la comunidad donde viven es lo que más se dedican porque muchas veces sus artesanías las ocupan para recuerdos de bodas.
texts.en:
El Mirador Group had worked previously with the institution, only there were more members and they met every time they made a payment.  This time there are fewer people, but all of them are very responsible.  The members decided on the name, which they chose because they all know a ranch called El Mirador.

Julia, 41, is the group representative.  She has been married to Valentín for 22 years and together they have formed a family with two children, one of whom is a student.  Julia has made a living for 14 years doing embroidery on napkins, textiles, etc.

Julia commented: "I started my job because my children were my motivation.  They were studying, and often there wasn't enough money to pay for all the household expenses.  I had to learn alone; also because my mother embroidered."  Her only difficulty is the lack of material because when she has orders to deliver she needs money.  Thanks to the loan from the institution, however, she'll be able to deliver her embroidery on time.

Julia's goal is for her son to finish his professional program so he can have a better quality of life.

The members are Antonia, Marcelina, and Julia, who also make a living in embroidery.  They comment that this is what they do most in their community because often their handiwork is bought as wedding mementos.

loans.use: to buy quadrille fabric, yarn, thread, etc.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Eufrocena

texts.en:
Eufrocena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 260000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Eufrocena has been in this business for 20 years. Eufrocena earns additional income from raising livestock.

Eufrocena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jeniffer has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Jeniffer requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.
