Jeniffer has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jeniffer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 17 years. Lilibeth earns additional income from furniture making.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
Cyril works hard to support her family. She is single and has a local eatery business in the Philippines.

Cyril requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Cyril would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for new tires

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen wanted to run her own store so she could be her own boss, but also because she considers being a shopkeeper to be an honorable profession. She has four children – aged 15, 6, 2 and 14 months – and her family has always worked in sales of some kind. 

According to Carmen, the most difficult part of running a small store is the administration. Before purchasing Tiendatek, Carmen would try to estimate her sales and profits using a notebook and a calculator but found it to be impossible given the number of different products in her inventory and her sales volume. Today, thanks to Tiendatek, she knows everything about her business and feels much more in control. She has also noticed that her clients trust her more now that she uses technology to register sales. Carmen plans to invest more money in her store soon so she can continue to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To manage her inventory and sales volume using Tiendatek

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: This holiday season support a young entrepreneur!  Robert owns a start-up business.  His business provides tax solutions to clients in and around Miami. Tax Solutions is a store-front business that services the needs of business owners like Robert.  Robert noticed that there is a huge need in Miami to support young business owners like himself with tax preparation.  Robert, therefore, focuses his business on not only providing tax assistance but also on providing the education around the importance of tax preparation.  Business owners often do not know the importance of preparing timely taxes in order to experience growth.  Robert helps his clients tremendously.  Help this start up business get the word out!  Robert needs capital to promote his new business. He needs marketing dollars to showcase his services in newspapers and magazines in the Miami area.

loans.use: to purchase advertising in newspapers and magazines in Miami to promote his new business

loans.name: Los Portales Group

texts.es:
Los Portales es un grupo integrado por 4 mujeres trabajadoras, alegres y amables cada una de ellas
desempeña una actividad economica con el propósito de dar a sus familias una mejor  calidad de vida. Miriam se dedica a la venta calzado, Silvia venta de ropa, Maritza farmacia, Ada Luz venta de cosméticos, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una región cañera.

Ada Luz tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Joel con el cual tiene un hijo, ella platica que hace tres meses con el apoyo de su esposo abrió  una pequeña farmacia en el centro de su comunidad ya que quería trabajar para ganar su propio dinero poder ayudar un poco en los gastos de su hogar. Ella dice que a pesar de tener poco tiempo su negocio ha ganado clientes a base del buen servicio y atención que les brinda a sus clientes. Ella esta muy contenta con su negocio y quiere poco a poco ir surtiendo mas su negocio para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella invertirá este crédito en la 
compra de variedad de medicamentos para resurtir su farmacia.

El grupo Los portales Agradece a Vision Fund por el apoyo que se les ha brindado atraves de este crédito.
texts.en:
“Los Portales” (The Portals) is a group of four, hardworking, cheerful, kind women.  Each one of them carries out an economic activity to give their families a better quality of life.  Miriam sells shoes, Silvia sells clothes, Maritza has a pharmacy and Ada Luz sells cosmetics.  The group is located in a sugarcane growing region.

Ada Luz is 38-years-old and completed high-school.  She’s married to Joel and they have a son.  With help from her husband she opened a small pharmacy three months ago in the center of her community because she wanted to work to earn her own money and be able to help a little with household expenses.  She says that despite being in business a short time she’s won over customers thanks to the good service and attention she gives to them.  She’s very happy with her business and wants to gradually stock it more to provide better customer service.  She will use the loan to buy a variety of medicines to stock her pharmacy.

The “Los Portales” group thanks Vision Fund for the support it’s giving them through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a supply of medicines.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina, de 47 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es madre de tres hijos 24, 21 y 16 años de edad, desde que ellos fueron pequeños tuvieron siempre todo el amor y protección que una verdadera madre puede ofrecer, tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de todos sus hijos luchando siempre para seguir adelante.
El trabajo de Lina consiste en diseñar y crear prendas de vestir, del mismo modo refacciona aquellas prendas que sus clientes le entregan con alguna imperfección hasta dejarlas en perfecto estado. Tiene su pequeño taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo por 18 años, esto le permitió alimentar a su familia por mucho tiempo y gracias a ello también sus hijos pudieron recibir una buena educación. Trabaja sola y esta muy contenta ya que le esta yendo bien aunque en ciertas temporadas la clientela disminuye.
Cuando se inició en esta actividad tenía dificultades por la falta de experiencia tales como la imprecisión en el corte de las telas o elegir la tela inadecuada para determinado tipo de prenda, sin embargo ha aprendido a superar estos contratiempos gracias al paso de los años y a las capacitaciones que ella misma buscaba para mejorar su trabajo. Ahora tiene mucha clientela  que siempre solicitan sus servicios es por eso que tiene como objetivo empezar a crear mayor cantidad de prendas especialmente vestidos para ocasiones especiales. Este es el crédito número 16 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales para seguir realizando su trabajo, entre ellos comprará elásticos, telas, botones, aplicaciones, encajes, hilos de colores y otros.
texts.en:
Lina, 47, is a good and kind woman.  She's the mother of three children, ages 24, 21, and 16.  Since they were little they always had all the love and protection that a true mother can offer.  She has her own house where she lives with all her children, always striving to get ahead.

Lina's job is designing and creating clothing.  She also mends imperfections in her customers' clothes, leaving them perfect.  She has her small workshop in her house and has been doing this work for 18 years.  This allowed her to feed her family for a long time and give her children a good education.  She works alone and is very happy because it's going very well for her, even though in certain seasons her clientele drops.

When she started this business she had problems because of her lack of experience, such as cutting the fabric imprecisely or choosing the wrong fabric for a particular type of garment.  Nevertheless she has learned to overcome these setbacks thanks to the passing of the years and the training that she herself sought so she could improve her work.  Now she has a lot of customers who always request her services.  This is why her goal is to create more garments, especially dresses for special occasions.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP.  She's grateful to all the people who make her loan possible, so she can continue doing her job with better results.  She's committed once again to making her payments punctually, just as she did with her previous loans.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

With the requested amount of 2000 soles [PEN] she'll buy materials to continue doing her work, including elastic, fabric, buttons, appliqués, lace, colored thread, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Tania

texts.en: Help Tania continue to grow her cleaning business!  Tania has been in operations for six years.  She is ready, however, to grow her business.  She has built a strong base of loyal customers. With this support, she is ready to take a leap and begin to provide services under larger contracts.  Tania has begun to dip her feet into cleaning hospitals and larger businesses.  She likes the challenge and welcomes the diversity of clientele working to clean hospitals while continuing to clean homes. Tania dedicates her time to the business and works many hours.  She needs a loan to hire new employees. "I have two children that I am proud to raise in my entrepreneurial family.  I am able to provide for my children and give them the education that will work to secure their futures.  I am from Cuba and did not have the same type of opportunities.  Here I have the freedom to run my own business and provide for my family”.  This holiday season support a growth business that will use the capital to hire new employees.

loans.use: to hire a new fulltime employee

loans.name: Normadia

texts.en:
Normadia is 50 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a business of buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos through Negro Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more stock to sell.

Normadia has borrowed and paid 15 loans through NWTF. She has been buying and selling nipa for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more nipa (woven mats used for house repair and construction) to sell

loans.name: Rose Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rose Marlene works hard to support her family. Her business is selling coconut vinegar in the Philippines. She also earns income from a general store. 

Rose Marlene is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through Negro Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional gallons of vinegar to sell. 

She has sustained her business  through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of vinegar to sell

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Sally works hard to support her family.

She has a cellphone accessories business in the Philippines; she also earns additional income from selling jewelry. Sally is borrowing 29500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more additional cellphone accessories to sell.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cellphone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Maribel has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a business making artificial teeth in the Philippines.

Pelita requested a 29500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her denture business.

She has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Pelita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her denture business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 50 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Tita has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell. Tita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Tita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 51 years old and has three children. She is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Cecilia raises pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cecilia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs .

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 37 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Araceli raises pigs in the Philippines. Araceli requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Araceli has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roohi

texts.en:
Ms Roohi is a 32-year-old married woman.  She has been doing a business of manufacturing spare part for sanitary items with her husband. Both are doing it together for the last 12 years. Her husband purchases scrap from market on lower rates, separates the iron from this scrap, and then Roohi cuts them in small pieces with the help of cutter and compressor. They make clamps on machine which are used as sanitary spare part and her husband sells them in market.

She is motivated to support her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy stock of iron from the market at lower rates for the making of more clamps. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize the part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of iron from the market at lower rates for the making of more clamps

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 60 años es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos junto a su esposo llamado Amaro, les brinda todo lo que necesitan y siempre está al pendiente de ellos a pesar que ya son adultos, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y solo 3 de sus hijos ya que el mayor de ellos está casado y es independiente. 
La actividad laboral de Rosa consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería y belleza femenina, todos los días sale a visitar a sus diferentes amigos, vecinos y familiares para ofrecer esperando poder vender algún perfume, talco o crema corporal, en algunas ocasiones espera que sus clientes acudan a su casa ya que tiene un amplia vitrina en donde exhibe los productos que pone a la venta, lleva realizando 9 años este trabajo y lo hace sola ya que no le gusta trabajar bajo la presión de otra persona. Complementa esta actividad vendiendo eventualmente jugos y empanadas.  Durante el tiempo de que lleva trabajando aprendió mucho y reforzó algunas técnicas de venta que antes ya conocía, agradece mucho a la vida porque le va bien, es conciente que tiene que trabajar mucho para poder tener éxito, espera mantener su clientela estable y seguir creciendo hasta establecer una tienda de cosméticos de mayor extensión en donde pueda ofrecer a la venta más productos y tener mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el préstamo número 7 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3000), comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por productos de perfumería y cosméticos para continuar vendiendo e incrementar su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa, 60 years old, is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She is married and has four children with her husband, Amaro. She provides her family with everything they need and she is always ready to help them even though they are now adults. Rosa lives in her own house along with her husband and her three unmarried children. 

She makes a living selling cosmetics, perfumes, and female beauty products. Each day she goes out to visit different friends, neighbors, and family members with the hope of selling a perfume, talcum powder, or body cream. Sometimes she also receives customers in her home, since she has a wide glass case where she displays her products for sale. Rosa has been selling cosmetics for nine years. She enjoys working independently without the pressure of working under another person. In addition to these sales, she hopes to begin selling juice and empanadas as well. Over the years in this business, she has learned a lot and developed some of her own sales techniques. 

Rosa is very thankful for how well life has been going for her and knows that she must work hard in order to be successful. She hopes to maintain a stable clientele and to keep growing her business until she can establish her own cosmetics store with extensions to offer other products as well and increase her profits. 

This is Rosa's seventh loan with MFP. She is very thankful for the opportunity this loan offers her as well as for the financial support that is necessary for her to get ahead. She pledges to make her monthly payments punctually and to continue working responsibly along with the other members of her communal bank. With the amount of the loan she's requesting (S/. 3000), Rosa will buy more merchandise for her store, such as perfumes and cosmetics, so that she may keep up her sales and expanding her clientele.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics in order to keep up her sales and expand her clientele.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is 26 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos through Negro Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more stock.

Donna has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Wilma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Wilma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Wilma would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 20 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mira has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. Mira has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Mira has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Mira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricyle.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Brenda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Brenda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Brenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling kitchenware in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more kitchenware and other home products.

NWTF is re-listing Carmen's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchenware and other home products.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, de 28 años, es una mujer buena y amable, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 años y 2 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo y sus hijos vive en una casa propia en donde comparten todos los días la alegría de progresar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
El trabajo de Rosmery consiste en la venta de comida, sale muy temprano al mercado en busca de los mejores ingredientes ya que le gusta brindar lo mejor a sus clientes, una vez que tiene todos los ingredientes seleccionados por sus mágicas manos, comienza a preparar los platos que ofrecerá a su distinguida clientela, al terminar su preparación lleva todo a los aserraderos de la ciudad en donde comienza a vender, trabaja solo a pedidos ya que su exquisita sazón hace que tenga muchos clientes, se inició vendiendo hace 1 año ya que tenia la necesidad de aportar económicamente al hogar. Esta muy contenta con su trabajo porque ella misma genera su fuente laboral, lo hace sola y le da tiempo de descansar tranquilamente y brindarle el tiempo necesario a su familia, tiene muchos planes para su futuro entre ellos está el de establecer un restaurante para no tener que estar yendo a lugares lejanos a vender, pero sabe que para ello necesita contar con el capital económico necesario y por ello trabajará mucho para juntarlo y consolidar su proyecto. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable, está muy contenta de continuar con este grupo ya que son muy cumplidos y amables. Con el  monto solicitado 1800 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su trabajo como arroz, condimentos, carnes y otros, además de algunas verduras y productos no perecibles.
texts.en:
Rosmery, 28 years old, is a good and kind woman, is married and has three children of 8, 4, and 2 years old. She lives along with her husband and children in her own home where every day they share the happiness of progressing and improving their living conditions.

Rosmery’s work consists of food sales. She goes to the market very early in search of the best ingredients since she likes to provide the best to her customers. Once she has all of the ingredients selected by her magic hands, she begins to prepare the dishes that she will offer to her distinguished clientele. When she finishes her preparations, she brings it all to the city’s sawmill where she begins to sell. She works only by request since her exquisite flavor means that she has many customers.

She began selling one year ago since she had the need to contribute economically to the home. She is very happy with her work because she generates her own source of work. She does it alone and it gives her time to relax peacefully and provides her the necessary time with her family. 
She has many plans for her future. Among those is to establish a restaurant in order to not have to be going to distant places to sell, but she knows that for this she needs to count on the economic capital necessary. For this she will work hard to put together and consolidate her project.

This is loan number 3 with MFP. She is very excited and thankful for the economic backing that they offer her to continue with her plans. She does not want to quit paying because of lack of money, and it is because of this that she promises to be very punctual and above all very responsible. She is very happy to continue with this group since they are very thoughtful and kind.

 With the amount requested of 1800 soles, she will buy ingredients and consumables in order to continue with her work, such as rice, condiments, meats, and others, as well as some vegetables and non-perishable products.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments, meats, and others.

loans.name: Ruseli

texts.es:
Ruseli, de 41 años, es una mujer amable y muy responsable, esta casada con Alfredo y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 17 y 8 años de edad respectivamente, tiene su casa propia que pudo comprar junto a su esposo y ahí comparten el mismo deseo por salir adelante y forjarse un mejor nivel de vida.
El trabajo de Ruseli consiste en la venta de abarrotes al por menor, es decir compra los productos en grandes cantidades y de ahí se encarga de venderlos al menudeo. Tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en un espacio de su casa la misma que pudo construir gracias al apoyo de su esposo. Entre los productos que ofrece tiene arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, enlatados, bebidas gaseosas, condimentos y otros. Su horario de atención se inicia desde muy temprano y culmina por la noche. Este trabajo lo esta haciendo desde hace 5 años, gracias a esta actividad pudo educar a sus hijos e implementar su casa con algunos artefactos. Complementa esta labor brindando servicio de peluquería en ciertas ocasiones ya que aún no tiene todos sus implementos de trabajo.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar múltiples actividades dentro de su casa, le está yendo muy bien ya que siempre tiene clientes que atender, sus ganancias son considerables y eso le permite realizar la compra de sus productos de manera continua, espera realizar algunos cambios en la infraestructura de su local de atención. Este es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. 
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, verduras entre otros, además mejorará la infraestructura de su tienda con la compra de maderas y clavos.
texts.en:
Ruseli, 41, is a friendly and very responsible woman. She is married to Alfredo and has three children, ages 21, 17 and 8. She has her own house that she was able to buy with her husband, and they share the same wish to move forward and forge a better quality of life for themselves.

Ruseli's work consists of the sales of groceries. She buys the products in great quantities and from there she sells them at retail prices. She has a small store installed in a space in her house, which she was able to build thanks to the support of her husband. Among the products she offers are rice, sugar, eggs, oil, canned goods, soda drinks, condiments, and more. Her business hours begin very early and end at night. She has been doing this work for five years, and thanks to that she has been able to educate her children and furnish her house with some appliances. She complements this work by offering hairdressing services on certain occasions since she still does not have all her work tools.

What she likes about her work is that she has time to do multiple activities inside her house. It is going very well for her since she always has clients to attend to. Her earnings are considerable and that allows her to purchase her products continuously. 

She hopes to make some changes to the infrastructure of her work premises. This is her second loan with MFP. She is thankful to those who offer her the loan that she requires to increase her working capital. She is committed to making her payments punctually, and is happy to belong to her community bank since its members are very united and responsible.

With the 1500 soles requested, she will buy a larger quantity of groceries like rice, bread, sugar, eggs, and vegetables among other things, as well as improving the infrastructure of her store by purchasing wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy rice, bread, sugar, eggs, vegetables, and more, and to improve the infrastructure of her store by buying wood and nails

loans.name: Buena Vista 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Vilma Florinda  esta casada, tiene 38 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria,tiene 2 hijos los cuales no estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio este negocio con un préstamo que realizo, hasta el momento lleva 9 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Organiza un grupo y solicitan un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de un telar e hilos para poder incrementar su trabajo y tener otro trabajadora para su negocio, espera en el futuro tener varios telares, una casa mas amplia y mas trabajadores. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la tejeduría, venta de frutas, venta de carne, ven ta de animales domésticos y a la venta de helados.
texts.en:
Vilma Florinda is 38 years old and married. She finished six years of primary school. She has two children who are not in school. She works weaving traditional fabrics. She started this business with a loan and she has nine years of experience. Vilma has the support of her husband who works in weaving. 

She is organizing a group and applying for a loan that they will use to buy a loom and thread to increase their work and have another worker for their business. In the future, she hopes to have several looms, a bigger house, and more workers. The rest of the group members work in weaving, selling fruit, meat, domestic animals, and ice cream.

loans.use: to buy a loom and raw materials

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a 7,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Editha is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en: Gumercinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 60,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy materials for her shells-crafting business. NWTF is presenting Gumercinda's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy materials for a shell-crafting business.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lagrimas works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lagrimas is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

Lagrimas has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 52 years old, married and has eight children. 

Porferia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Porferia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her business.

Porferia has been raising pigs for four years now. She has previously borrowed three times from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Porferia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her business

loans.name: Tereso

texts.en:
Tereso is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of his income.

Tereso is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights for his fishing business. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thereby giving him more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 40-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now.

Joy is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. Through the equipment funded by this loan, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Joy hopes of expanding their business in the future and saves money for reinvestment in this business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 49 years old and married with 6 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Julie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Julie requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Julie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Julie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts.

Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie. She previously accessed a 22,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Melanie dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education and hopes to buy a truck through all of her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own car. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials and scrap needed in her business.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is a farmer who weaves at home when she is free from farming. Her husband, Sam-ol, has a business of buying, raising and selling cows and oxen.

Pao and her husband have been married since 1982, and they have four children: one son and three daughters. They are living in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Pao is applying for a loan of $1,000 for her husband. Pao’s husband will use the capital from the loan to continue his business by purchasing more cows and oxen to resell.

loans.use: To provide her husband with capital to purchase more cows and oxen to resell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan, 42 years old, is married to Norlinda. They help each other to manage their farm. In order to have a nice living condition, Allan is requesting a loan of PHP 48,000 to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business. Allan hopes that in the future he can expand his farm to meet the needs of his family, especially the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elenise

texts.en: Elenise is 22 years old and single with no children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and yams that she sells in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Elenise needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, a weedkiller spray, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Elenise will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, bush knives, weedkiller spray, etc.

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
Srey Mom, is 38 and her husband, Sok, is 36. They live in in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children, three sons and one daughter. 

Srey Mom and her husband are farmers. They grow rice and lotus on their farmland in the village where they live. Srey Mom’s husband is also a fisherman when he is not at the farm.  

Srey Mom is asking for her first Kiva loan of $1,500 to buy a water pumping machine because her rice and lotus farms are far from each other. It’s difficult for her to move water, pumping from the rice farm to the lotus farm. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy one water pumping machine, seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
This is Benilda, 48, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, who is on a maintenance staff, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Benilda has a calamansi (Panama orange) scent business. She buys the ingredients needed and then mixes them to come up with the desired scent. The main ingredients of the scent is calamansi. She then retails them to some stores. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the nearby communities. She earns a minimum of PHP 4000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of coco lumber for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Benilda dreams to grow her business in the coming years and hopes to give her children a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for calamansi (Panama orange) scent, other ingredients and bottles needed for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 36-year-old married woman with six young children from Talibon, Bohol. She  has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now.
Elena is asking for a loan to buy nets, bamboo sticks, buckets and other items for fishing. With this, they will be able to enhance their catch thus providing more fish and other sea products, like crabs and clams, to sell in the market.
In the future, Elena dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy nets, bamboo sticks, buckets and other items for her fishing business.

loans.name: Mohand Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mohand, and it consists of 6 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 300000 YER from AMB.
Samah is a 33-year-old woman; she is married and a mother to two children. She is a housewife who lives Taiz, Yemen. 

She needs to change her old bedroom furniture, so she is requesting a loan of 50000 YER from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture. This will enable her to be healthy and comfortable and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Isabel, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia continúa con sus actividades como administrativa en un colegio de la ciudad y también continúa dedicándose a la artesanía, principalmente elaborando bordados para elementos de imaginería religiosa,  Isabel está solicitando el préstamo para comprar materiales como telas, hilos dorados, accesorios y encajes. Isabel esta muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower is Sra. Isabel. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Lideres” (The Leaders), which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. Isabel continues her activities, including her job as a school administrator in the city. She also continues to make handicrafts, mainly embroideries that have elements of religious imagery.

Isabel is requesting a loan so that she can buy materials such as fabrics, gold thread, accessories, and lace. She is very grateful to Kiva for enabling her to continue her business, since it provides the main source of income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, gold thread, accessories, and lace.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф живет в городе Вахдат. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Ему 49 лет. У Шарифа на сегодняшний день есть помещение, где он собирается открыть продуктовый магазин. Шариф берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Шариф коммуникабельный и хороший человек. Он заранее благодарит Кива и кредиторов Кива.
texts.en: Sharif lives in the town of Vahdat. He is married and has four children. He is 49 years old. Today Sharif has a space where he plans to open a grocery store. Sharif is taking out the loan to buy food to start his business. He is a sociable and good man. He is thanking Kiva and lenders in advance.

loans.use: to purchase food.

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jeaneth mujer trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación saco adelante a sus hijos con su trabajo como conserje labor que se devenga un salario muy bajo pero a cómo puede ella va progresando haciendo mejoras en su hogar con créditos de Afodenic y Kiva, este cuarto préstamo lo solicita para hacer otro cuarto en su casa para mayor comodidad de sus hijos y seguir acondicionando su hogar paso a paso, por lo que necesita comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is a hardworking woman who, with great effort and dedication, provides for her children through her work as a custodian. This job pays her a very low salary, so the way she is able to progress in making improvements to her home is with loans from Afodenic and Kiva. 

She is requesting this fourth loan to build another room on her house to better accommodate her children and to continue equipping her home step by step. To do this, she needs to buy cinderblocks, cement, sand, and rebar and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase cinderblocks, cement, sand, and rebar and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beatriz es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de comida, tienda de refrescos y otros, venta de papa, costura de sombreros y prendas, tienda de venta de carne, costura de pantalones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Beatriz es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que se incorporó a la institución por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio de venta de tejido de chompas, cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de una institución de enseñanza técnica y posteriormente decide trabajar realizando estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su negocio (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones de salud y crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “FLOR KANTUTA” community association is made up of eight members and will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana branch.  It’s directed by a board of directors where Beatriz serves as the treasurer.  The members run various types of businesses, such as knitting sweaters, selling food, soft drink stores, potato sales, hat and clothes making, butcher shop, and making pants.

This loan will help the small businesses, of which Beatriz has one of them.  She says that this will be the first time she is part of an institution, which she joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her at home.  She has a sweater making business and learned this art form at a trade school, and later decided to work in this field. 

She will use the money from this loan to diversify her business.  She will buy wool from distributers and then resell it from her place of business.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her family, since she lives with her husband and three children.

When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she says that she likes the training on borrowing and saving.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Faasala

texts.en: Faasala is 34 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Faasala needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush-knives,  weedkiller spray, more tiapula, and pay for her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Faasala will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Feagai

texts.en: Feagai is 65 years old and married with nine children. She has a small taxi business providing transportation to the public. She has been doing this for five years. Feagai needs a loan to buy a cover for her steering wheel, clutch, hand brakes, and more tires, as well as, floor mats for the taxi. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009 to gain access to financial stability. Feagai will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy car parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan, age 51 and her husband, Yun, age 52, have been married since 1990 and have five sons. The family is living in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophan and her husband are farmers. They grow lotus and rice on their farmland in the village where they live.  

Sophan is asking for her first Kiva loan of $1,000 to buy a water pumping machine to spray her rice. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy a water pumping machine, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy earns a living by selling home-cooked foods to the people in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than ten years now.

Ivy is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for cooking like vegetables, meat, seasoning, cooking oil and others. With the ingredients funded by this loan, she will be able to cook more food to sell.

In the future, Ivy hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking like vegetables, meat, seasoning, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa, de 35 años, es una mujer esforzada y alegre. Vive en su casa propia junto a  su conviviente  Yavaly, quien se dedica hacer taxi. Tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 3 años. El trabajo de Josefa consiste en la confección de ropas para caballeros, damas y niños. Su actividad la realiza en la casa de unas de sus amigas, quien es su socia. Se inició en esta actividad ayudando en una empresa de textiles, ahí aprendió lo necesario y decidió comprar su  maquina de coser para trabajar en su casa. Al pasar el tiempo una amiga le propuso que trabajasen juntas, que formaran una sociedad para poder abastecer a sus clientes. Ahora han contratado a 2 señoras para que las ayuden y trabajen organizadas. Comenta que su negocio es rentable por la cantidad de clientes que la vienen a buscar. Ahora tiene trato con instituciones para confeccionar uniformes. Cada día sus clientes se incrementan. Antes de iniciar su actividad económica tenía temor de poner su negocio propio. Pero una amiga la animó y la apoyo a realizar sus primeras confecciones, hasta ahora todo le esta yendo bien, cada día ve como su producción se incrementa y tiene ganancias económicas positivas. Espera mantenerse en este negocio y contar con local propio. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, y con ella desea . comprar materiales, como: telas, hilos, para su negocio, además mandará arreglar su mototaxi para que este en mejores condiciones  y pueda distribuir su mercadería.
texts.en:
Josefa, who is 35 years old, is a hard-working and cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her spouse Yavaly, who earns a living driving a taxi. They have two children who are 12 and 3 years old. 

Josefa's work consists of making clothing for men, women, and children. She performs this work in the home of one of her friends, who is her business parter. She began in this line of work by helping in a textile business. There, she learned the basics and decided to buy a sewing machine so she could work at home. As time went by, a friend suggested that they work together, so they formed a company to meet their clients' needs. They have now hired two women to help them get the work done efficiently. She says that her business is profitable because of the quantity of customers who seek them out. Now, they have deals with institutions for whom they sew uniforms. Every day, their customer base increases. 

Before starting her business, Josefa was afraid of starting her own business, but a friend encouraged her and supported her in creating her first garments. So far, everything is going well for her. Every day, she sees how her production is increasing and she has positive earnings. 

Josefa hopes to remain in this business and have her own shop. This will be her second loan with MFP and she plans to use the loan to buy materials like fabric and thread for her business. In addition, she will have her mototaxi [a three-wheeled vehicle] repaired so that it will be in good shape and able to distribute her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, and zippers.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, she previously accessed an 22,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials, like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes to have a peaceful life and dreams to give her family a good future. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon, in the photo, is 50 years old and she and her husband Pao have been married since 1996. They have four children--two sons and two daughters--who are attending grades 3, 5, 7 and 8. The family is living in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Sokhon and her husband are rice and lotus farmers. In addition, their business is also in fish farming. 

Sokhon is requesting her first Kiva loan in the amount of US $300 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Eunice has been in this business for 8 years. Eunice earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Eunice has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari has a strong will to prosper, and his main goal is to have a better future and start a new life away from the delinquency surrounding him. He owns a house where he lives together with his family.

Omari has been operating a butcher shop for a long time, and he has lots of experience, which is why he makes good profits. He is well known among people in his community, and he has many customers that prefer his products because of their quality and affordable prices, because he listens to his customers and because his service has no equal.

Omari is a fighter--a man committed to his labor and determined to make his dreams come true. He works hard every day in order not to disappoint his family and to be a role model. He feels glad and comfortable with the business he has and wants to continue working to keep it afloat. This is why he is requesting a loan from Yehu in order to buy meat in bulk. He has good references and he is responsible. He promises to pay the loan, and he is confident that he will provide his family with economic stability.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk fo his business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: This is 30 year-old Samuel.  He is single and has two children aged 6 and 4 years. In 2008, Samuel established his Boutique business. He began his business just to be self reliant.  His business is located at the center of the city and his main customers are visitors to the market. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Samuel requires a loan in order to buy textiles. In the future, Samuel plans to open another outlet so that he can deploy one of his cousins. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profit by approximately Le 1,000,000. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Perfil Karla 
C 600.000,  Puntarenas.
	 Es madre de 3 hijos, tiene 37 años vive en la zona de Puntarenas, en él Pacífico Central de Costa Rica;   obtuvo el bachillerato en un colegio técnico,  ha trabajado en varias empresas en el área contable pero la necesidad económica y el tener hijos pequeños no le permitieron seguir de esta forma;  ella junto a su esposo decidieron que estuviera en la casa ya que él trabaja como guardacostas y se ausenta 2 semanas al mes. Con decisión y ante la necesidad económica decide arriesgar un capital hace 2 años con el que inició, manteniendo hasta la fecha un micro negocio.  Invirtió la mitad del dinero del alquiler de la casa, comprando bisutería y comenzó a venderla en su barrio y en las instituciones de la zona, recuperando el dinero y obteniendo una ganancia con la cual ha seguido comprando mercadería. Buscando la posibilidad de crecer se acerca a la Oficina de la Mujer  de Puntarenas donde le brindan información de Fundación Mujer. Desea incrementar su capital y así comprar otros productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos para el apoyo a su hogar.

	. Ella tiene una pensión de 60000 colones por su hijo mayor y los otros dos son apoyados por su actual esposo. Ella busca el crecimiento de su empresa ya que se ha consolidado en su zona pero no le alcanza lo ganado para comprar otros productos de mayor valor como ropa y bolsos de moda, para damas.


	 Emprendedora acostumbrada a trabajar y desarrollar sus capacidades laborales de la mejor forma,  han ido mejorando su calidad de vida, ya que adquirió una casa propia de bienestar social. Su mayor deseo es tener su propio bazar pero va avanzando poco a poco, si requiere de un capital para diversificar su mercadería y poder crecer con su negocio, el cual es pequeño pero consolidado.

Este año con un préstamo inicial por parte de KIVA y Fundación Mujer pudo invertir más y variada mercadería, pero debido a un accidente por evitar que su hijo de 3 años sufriera daño se fractura ambas manos impidiendo seguir desarrollando su negocio. Ante esta situación siguió haciendo frente a la deuda y ahora ya recuperada solicita de nuevo el apoyo para reactivar su negocio, una vez superadas las secuelas del accidente.
texts.en:
Profile: Karla, 600.000 CRC, Puntarenas.

Karla has three children; she is 37 years old and lives in Puntarenas, Central-Pacific region of Costa Rica. She finished high school in a technical school and has worked in several companies for the accounting department. However, economic problems and the fact that she had three small children, made her quit. Karla and her husband decided that she would stay at home, since he works as a coastguard and is away two weeks every month.

Two years ago, she made a decision, given her economic situation, to invest some capital in a micro-business that is still afloat today. She invested half the money in renting the house and she bought imitation jewelry that she sells in her neighborhood and in different local companies. With the profit she makes, she buys more merchandise.

Karla wants to expand her business and this is why she went to the Office for Women of Puntarena, where they gave her information about Fundación Mujer [Foundation Woman]. She wants to increase her capital and buy other types of products to offer her customers and increase her income for supporting her family.

She receives 60.000 CRC of child maintenance for her oldest son and the other two are provided for by her current husband. She wants to expand her business knowing that she is well-known in the region. However, she does not make enough money to buy other products that are more valuable, like clothes and trendy purses for women.

She is an enterprising woman, used to working and developing her skills. They have improved their quality of life and they bought their own house through a social welfare housing program. Her biggest dream is to have her own establishment, but she takes one step at a time. She needs a small capital in order to diversify her stock and be able to expand her business, which is small but well-known.

Karla could invest in more merchandise thanks to a loan from KIVA and Fundación Mujer that she got this year. However, she broke both arms trying to protect her three-year-old child from getting hurt, and could not continue to develop her business. Nevertheless, she continued to pay the debt she had and now that she is back on her feet she is looking again for support in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase imitation jewelry, in addition to clothing and bags for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 63-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has owned a small grocery shop for two years. He is well known with a good reputation for special customer care.

Mohamad works hard to fill his family's needs. He used to work helping people moving furniture and other agricultural products from one place to another, which is in fact tough work for a person his age because it needs a lot of physical effort, which he doesn't have at all at this age.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with special winter offers.

When we asked Mohamad about his plans for the future, his answer was that he dreams of expanding his retail shop to a wider market. This will be his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped him a lot in increasing the variety of products he sells.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special winter offers

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Benito, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Yolanda operates a vegetable growing farm. She grows vegetables and fruit in their farm located in Cavite, in the high lands where the climate is suited to growing vegetables and fruit. She sells her produce at the market and to fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies such as seed and fertilizer for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Yolanda dreams of being able to give her family a good future and dreams of expanding her business through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married and has four children. She is a Form Four leaver. Martha sells charcoal and vegetables at Kisauni, near Mombasa. She has been in this business for some time now. Her husband is a security officer. Martha uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of their children and other family issues.

She will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Martha plans to buy more products.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms. Nazia is a 45-year-old married woman and she has been running a business selling clothes.  Even at this age she is determined to support her family. Her husband is retired from his job and is on pension. One of her son is doing a job in the same department as his father’s replacement. Nazia is a mother of eight children; three of them are school-going while others are married. She is a self-made woman and wants to live her life with integrity. That’s why she started her business soon after she realized  that her husband was going to retire soon. 

She very carefully selected her business as she wanted to have a profitable business. So she started a business of clothes trading, thinking that she could easily do it in her house. This business really turns out to be a profitable one as woman from the surrounding community started purchasing clothes from her. With the support of Kashf Foundation she has gradually improved her business. 

Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase more variety of clothes in many colors and designs, considering the choice of her customers. She expects a gain in her net income and wishes to utilize part of the profits on the expansion of her business. She is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of clothes in many colors and designs

loans.name: Medilina

texts.en:
Medilina is 54 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells coffee beans in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of coffee beans to sell.

Medilina has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 30 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Medilina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of coffee beans to sell

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 23 years old lives with his wife and daughter in ger in Uvs Province, Mongolia. His wife Enhtor has just started working as assistant worker in a governmental organization. His daughter Soyolmaa is 8 months old stays home with her  grandmother during day. Batsaihan used to provide transportation services to local customers, but it is a seasonal job because during winter driving from Uvs Province to Ulaanbaatar, the capital, is nearly impossible. He is now starting a permanent shoe store at a rental counter in the local market. He is requesting 3000000 MNT to purchase inventory and start his business. He is a hardworking, diligent and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and start a new permanent shoe store.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is a married lady. Her husband is a businessman, while she is a retailer. She chose to start a small retail business at home to kill her boredom and make an additional income. She buys glass home pieces and appliances. Then, she resells them to friends and neighbors at a higher price after she brings her products from a wholesale market and free zone areas.

Now, Sanita has applied for Yehu loan to increase her quantity of products.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans and coffee. They also have cows and pigs. 

Paul looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Paul will save to buy more land. He has always dreamed of being able to serve his community in an impactful way and is very excited about this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 29 years old. She is married and has four children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow maize and coffee. They also keep cows and pigs. 

Prossy looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Prossy will pay school fees for her children. Her biggest dream is to be able to purchase a plot of land where she would build an orphanage in her village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a hairdresser at Kisauni, near Mombasa. Winnie has attended hairdressing school. She is single and has no child. Winnie has been a hairdresser for the past 2 years. She assists her parents with family needs as part of her responsibilities. She will use her loan to buy more hair products for her work. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to recruit more workers.

loans.use: to buy more hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 48-year-old divorced father of five children. He sacrifices his life to raise them properly and provide them with the best living ever. He has worked in agriculture for twenty years, and has wide experience in harvesting, planting, and distributing his production.

Hassan is an ideal father who works the whole day planting, neglecting the sun's heat during the summer season and extreme cold in winter, in order to provide his five children a normal life.

Hassan is applying a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new van to distribute his vegetables among his customers, since he sold his old van because of its miserable mechanical and physical situation.
.
This would be his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; he has a good repayment history. His previous loan helped him to improve his business a lot.

Hassan is planning to expand his business more and more, through increasing his variety of produce and expanding his distribution zone.

loans.use: to buy a new van to distribute his products.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in Mombasa, Kenya.

She is borrowing 20,000 KES through Yehu Microfinance to buy more fish to sell in her fish vending business. Mapenzi has been in this business for 3 years. Mapenzi earns additional income from her vegetable stall.

Mapenzi has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from Yehu Microfinance. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Abdallah-Aziiz

texts.en:
Abdallah-Aziiz is 33 years old. He is married and has five children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, coffee, cassava and bananas. They also keep cows, goats and chickens.

Abdallah-Aziiz looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Abdallah-Aziiz will invest in his farming business. His biggest dream is to convert his small-scale farm into a large-scale commercial farm, and to be a prosperous farmer who serves as a role model for his neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Agnes operates a food market business in Mombasa. Agnes requested a 20,000 KES loan amount through Yehu Microfinance to purchase additional ingredients for her food market business. Agnes has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food market business

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 30 years old. He lives in Akhalkalaki, with his wife and two children (two and eight years old). Suren’s father has a grocery store in the district and Suren helps him run the business. He has an income from his father’s business. So, Suren decided to start-up his own business. He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start the business, but he hasn't had any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his lack of experience, which local credit providers usually demand. Suren plans to set up meat store locally. 

His loan request was approved under the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Suren will purchase refrigerators, a mincing-machine and a truck for meat transportation. He will also use the loan to purchase a stock of meat. He has already renovated the store in the town centre. The place is profitable as it is populous, and it does not have a meat store nearby. This will increase sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of Suren's family.

loans.use: to set up a meat store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a retail business for a period of 9 years. He started with capital he earned from agriculture, where he harvested maize and sold it at a very good price.

He says that price fluctuation is a factor affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Stephen intends to use a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stationery and furniture for her son's academy

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Juliet is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in  Kagadi, Uganda and is a government employee working as a primary school teacher. She decided to join the profession due her desire to inspire young people. Juliet says that teaching is a calling more than a profession to her.  She owns a piggery project to supplement her salary.

Juliet is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay school fees for herself.  Her main hardship is a low salary while her dreams are to upgrade her studies and expand her piggery project.

loans.use: to pay school fees for herself.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 25 years old. She is married and has three children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow maize, beans, cassava, Irish potatoes, bananas and sweet potatoes. They also keep cows, chickens and pigs. 

Agnes looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Agnes will pay school fees for her children. Her biggest dream is to see all of her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para tener más capital para invertir al negocio, comprando arroz, frijoles, huevos, aceite, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para el buen funcionamiento del negocio.
Ella manifiesta que su experiencia con el préstamo anterior le permitió tener surtido el negocio, tener los productos necesarios para atender a los clientes, sus circunstancias familiares son mejor porque sus ingresos tambien han mejorado.
texts.en:
Ana decided to request another loan so that she can have more capital to invest in her business and buy rice, beans, eggs, cooking oil, and other things necessary for the well-functioning of her business.

She says that her experience with the previous loan allowed her to stock her business and have the necessary products on hand for her customers.  Her family situation is better because her income has also increased.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mukasa

texts.en:
