The harvested products are sold seasonally. Alongside this, they run a small dairy farm of two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Sopio and Gocha decided to start their business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Sopio will purchase a car and her husband will serve to local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Doña Isabel está optando a su sexto crédito con Afodenic para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio la venta de cosméticos por catálogos por encargo y en su casa también, con este préstamo comprara perfumes, ropa variada de damas y caballeros ella tiene 5 años de experiencia con este tipo de negocio que a veces las ventas son buenas y otras malas pero se ayuda bastante con su ingreso fijo que es el de su labor como cocinera en un preescolar, poco remunerado pero de esa manera ella le brinda a sus hijos lo necesario para el sustento diario y los gastos de la escuela para que ellos se desarrollen y obtengan su profesión.
texts.en: Isabel is opting for her 6th Afodenic loan to continue investing in her business selling cosmetics on order via catalogue and from home too.  She will use this loan to buy perfume and assorted clothes for women and men.  She has five years’ experience in this type of business and sometimes sales are good and others they are bad but she helps herself out with her steady salary as a preschool cook; it’s poorly paid but she is able to provide her children with daily sustenance and pay their school costs so that they can develop and obtain their profession.

loans.use: to buy perfume and assorted clothes for women and men.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, está realizando su labor agrícola, por eso solicita el aporte de un crédito que le cubra los gastos en abono e insecticidas, que son los necesarios para prevenir las plagas y aumentar la cosecha, este aporte será importante para la siembra.
Con el préstamo anterior él realizo su cultivo, compro lo necesario en insumos y unos bueyes, obtuvo una buena cosecha para vender y alimentar a la familia, sus condiciones económicas han sido mejor.
texts.en: Luis is doing his agricultural work and needs a loan to cover costs of manure and insecticide which are needed to avoid infestations and increase crop yield; this contribution will be important for the crop.  He used his previous loan to plant; he bought the necessary supplies and some oxen.  He obtained a good harvest to sell and to feed his family; his economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: Don José está optando a su decimo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, la venta de productos plásticos, electrodomésticos, ropa y calzado hace aproximadamente 7 años se ha dedicado a esta labor en conjunto con su esposa quien le ayuda a vender, don José después de andar vendiendo ambulante ha logrado poner su pequeño establecimiento ahora con este crédito desea comprar mas productos de plásticos, ropa variada, calzados entre otros y de esta manera seguir ejerciendo su comercio que le ha ayudado a sostener los gastos del hogar los estudios de sus 2 hijos quienes continúan preparándose lo cual para ellos es prioridad principal la educación.
texts.en:
Don José has chosen to request his 10th loan so that he can continue investing in his business of selling plastic goods, household appliances, clothing, and shoes. He has been in this line of work for approximately seven years. His wife helps with making sales. After having worked as a traveling street vendor, Don José opened a small establishment.

With this new loan, he will now be able to buy more plastic goods, various articles of clothing, shoes, and other products so that he can keep his business in operation. This will help him maintain the household expenses and the educational costs of his two children who are continuing to prepare themselves. For Don José and his family, education is a top priority.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods, clothing, shoes, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para seguir en la venta de tortillas, se comprara maíz, gas propano, comal nuevo, con los materiales tendrá para un periodo de tiempo que le permita mejorar su venta.

Ella considera que con la inversión del préstamo anterior, pudo satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, con lo que ha tenido ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, ha construido un nuevo cuarto en su casa.
texts.en: Reina has opted for a new loan to continue selling tortillas.  She will buy corn, propane gas and a new griddle.  With these supplies she’ll have enough for a time so she can improve her sales.  She considers that with her investment of the previous loan she was able to meet customer demand which has led to income to cover family costs; she’s also built a new room onto her house.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane and a new griddle.

loans.name: Maranatha De Samarie 4 Group

texts.fr:
Nelta est la coordonatrice de son groupe Maranatha de Samarie 4. Elle habite dans la région de Samarie d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle est marie et elle a 2 d'enfants. 

Nelta a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 4 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de produits. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour faire du commerce comme vendre des produits alimentaires, vetements, charbon et des produits cosmetique. Nelta dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce et ayant une entreprise prospère; avec l'aide de Dieu et de Esperanza.
texts.en:
Nelta is the coordinator of her group, Maranatha de Samarie 4. She lives in the region of Samarie in Haiti, where electricity is rarely available and the water supply extremely limited. She is married and has two children. 

Nelta has been managing a business selling various products for the past four years. She would like to use this loan to invest in more products. Other members of the group need a loan to help with their businesses, selling items such as food products, clothing, charcoal and cosmetic products. Nelta says her dream is to expand her business and run a prosperous company, with the help of God and Esperanza.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 42-year-old hard working lady and she is very eager to support her family. 

She started her general store business two years ago with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Her brother also assists her in buying goods for the general store. She needs daily use goods to continuously meet her customer demand. 

For this she is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 to increase her stock of rice, flour and grains. She hopes to increase her income by catering to more customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of five young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the fishing business together with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income.
Luisa is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage. With this, they will be able to enhance their daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Luisa hopes to improve their business so that it will augment their income. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school for better learning.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage

loans.name: Tamazi

texts.en:
Tamazi is 34 years old. He lives with his wife, 2 daughters and mother in Partskhisi District. Tamazi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the small income earned by Tamazi’s mother, working as cook locally. This makes in total 200 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamazi requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Tamazi will trade in clothing and bed-clothes. He plans to purchase clothing and bed-clothes from wholesalers and resell it locally. It will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to trade in clothing and bed-clothes

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 50 years old. She lives in the city of Vanadzor with her husband, student daughter, and mother-in-law. Her son now lives and works in the Russian Federation and, from time to time, helps his family in Armenia. 

Marieta has a bachelor's degree in the field of pedagogy. She used to work as a teacher in Vanadzor’s secondary school, but because of teachers' low salaries in Armenia, she decided to change her work position.

More than one year ago, Marieta engaged in the clothes trading business. She rents a stall in one of Vanadzor's trading centers and re-sells men’s, women’s and children’s clothes, which she imports from Yerevan wholesale markets. Her husband is working in the construction sphere, so Marieta runs and makes her business alone. With the profit from her business, Marieta solves her family's needs and pays her daughter’s education fees. 

Marieta asks from Kiva lenders 1000000 AMD to buy a new assortment of men’s, women’s, and children’s clothes for the winter trading season.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of men’s, women’s, and children’s clothes for the winter trading season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a 33-year-old man, dealing in goat trading as his major source of income. He has been doing the business for the last six years. With his profits, he has managed to take his children to school, construct a permanent house, and to add to his piece of land. 

Frank has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to purchase more goats, for sale at a profit. His current stock was reduced when most of them fell sick and died. He wants to restock his farm and replace those goats that died.

Frank is a very hard-working man, and he hopes that his goat farm will regain its original strength in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale

loans.name: Ma. Ailyn

texts.en:
Maria Ailyn is a 35-year-old, married woman, and the mother of four young children, from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband. She helps him sell his catch in the market.

Maria Ailyn is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, buckets, lead weights and hooks. This will help her husband to improve his catch.

Maria Ailyn hopes to make their fishing business a success in the future. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and other fishing gear.

loans.name: Ebennecer Group

texts.es:
Judith es uno de los miembros del grupo Ebennecer, este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de El Zapote y la principal fuente de empleo es en el campo en la siembra y recolección de caña de azúcar. Judith tiene 18 años, solo estudio la secundaria y se encuentra soltera, Judith platica que desde hace un 1 año inicio con la idea de tener su propio negocio ya que la situación económica es muy difícil, y se le complico encontrar un trabajo. Ella está muy contenta con su negocio porque  puede ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Judith se dedica a la  venta de perfumes, su manera de realizar sus ventas es saliendo a visitar a sus amigas y vecinas de la comunidad casa por casa, muestra el catalogo de sus perfumes y sus clientas le hacen los pedidos. Judith dice que con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo ya que día a día tiene más clientes  en ocasiones la llegan a buscar a sus casa para comprar más productos. Ella invirtirá este crédito en la compra de catálogos y algunos perfumes para tenerlos en exhibición y mostrarles a sus clientas las fragancias que hay en su catalogo. Judith espera que en un futuro su negocio pueda tener ganancias productivas ya que desea rentar un local y allí vender sus productos.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Nemesio venta de pollo,
Graciela venta de comida,
Enrique venta de pescado,
Máximo renta de alzadora,
texts.en:
Judith is one of the members of the “Ebennecer” group located in the community of El Zapote.  The main source of employment is planting the fields and harvesting sugarcane.  Judith is 18-years-old and only completed secondary school.  She’s single.  Judith relates that a year ago she started with the idea of having her own business because the economic situation is very difficult and finding a job was complicated.  She’s very happy with her business because she’s able to help her mother with the household expenses.  Judith sells perfumes and her customers place orders.  Judith says that with the passage of time her business has been growing since every day she has more customers who sometimes even come by her house to buy more products.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of catalogues and some perfume to have on display to show her customers the fragrances that are in her catalogue.  Judith hopes in future that the business will produce productive profits because she wants to rent a locale to sell her products in.

The other group members are:

Nemesio - chicken sales,
Graciela - food sales,
Enrique -fish sales,
Máximo - sugarcane loader rental.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes.

location.town: El Zapote, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Machac Qhantati Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHAC QHANTATI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: lechería, costura de enaguas, tienda de refrescos, venta de queso, tienda de abarrotes, chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Nancy es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que se incorporó a la institución por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de un negocio en el que trabajaba anteriormente y posteriormente decide abrir su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su negocio (compra de abarrotes, cerveza y tarjetas telefónicas) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Machac Qhantati” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Nancy.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which are dairy, traditional skirt sewing, soft-drink store, cheese sales, grocery store, driver.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen with various lines of work.  Nancy is one of them.  She says this is the first time she’s joined the institution having been invited by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a grocery store, a business she learned by working previously in a store and then deciding to open her own business.

The loan she’ll take out is to diversify her business.  She will buy grocery items, beer and mobile phone airtime cards from suppliers and then sell them in her store.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support her family as possible since she’s single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, beer and telephone airtime cards.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 49 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy emprendedora, es una mujer que no tiene miedo a las dificultades que le pone el destino, ya que pudo criar sola a su única hija y le dio educación y los cuidados necesarios. Ahora vive junto a ella y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia, en donde todos los días comparten juntos las ganas y entusiasmo de salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
El trabajo de Juana consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, se encarga de realizar sus propios diseños, además realiza la refacción de otras prendas que le solicitan sus clientes ya que confían en que ella hará un muy buen trabajo, tiene un taller pequeño en su casa y desde ahí realiza toda su labor, se inició en su trabajo hace 15 años, empezó realizando trabajos simples y la experiencia que ha obtenido ahora le permiten crear prendas mas complejas dándoles un buen acabado y detalles personalizados. Trabaja sola y esta mas que contenta de hacer lo que le gusta. Le esta yendo muy bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes quienes la buscan muy a menudo, al principio se sentía de poca utilidad en su casa pero decidió emprender algún negocio y ahora está muy contenta porque su labor le ha permitido realizar su vida con cierta tranquilidad, ahora desea trabajar mas para hacer crecer su negocio.
Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, comprará materiales para poder seguir con su trabajo,  entre las cosas que comprara serán, telas, hilos, elásticos y moldes para confeccionar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Juana, 49, is a good, kind, very enterprising woman who isn’t afraid of the difficulties fate places before her since she was able to raise her only daughter by herself giving her education and the necessary care.  She now lives with her and her two grandchildren in her own house where every day they share together the desire and the will to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

Juana’s work consists in designing and sewing articles of clothing.  She makes her own designs and also repair items her customers request since the trust she’ll do a good job. She has a small workshop at home and she works from there.  She started the business 15 years ago doing simple jobs and the experience she’s gained now makes it possible for her to create more complex items giving them good finishing touches and personalized details.  She works alone and is more than happy to do what she loves.  She’s doing very well because she has many customers who seek her out often.  At the beginning she didn’t feel very useful at home but decided to start a business and now she’s very happy because her work has allowed her to live her life with a degree of tranquility.  Now, she wants to work more to make her business grow.

This is MFP loan #3.  She thanks those people who provide the loan she needs to increase her working capital.  She will use the requested 1,800 sols to buy materials to continue working.  Among them will be fabric, thread, elastic and patterns to sew larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and patterns.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, continua en su negocio de la tienda, quiere surtirla para la temporada navideña, por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de boquitas, jugos, golosinas, jabón y lejía, dulces y arroz. Entre otras cosas que sean necesarias para mantener lo necesario al servicio de los clientes.
Ella manifiesta que su negocio se ha mantenido estable, ha logrado surtir el negocio para vender, en algunos meses estuvo atendiendo a su padre quien enfermo y murió, esto le afecto su economía, pero sigue trabajando, con la ilusión de crecer.
texts.en:
María is still running her store and wants to stock it with products for the holiday season. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy snacks, juices, candy, soap, bleach, and rice  - as well as other things that are necessary to offer to her customers. 

She states that her business has remained stable, and she has managed to stock it to be able to makes sales. For a few months, she was looking after her father, who was sick and died. This affected her income, but she continues working with hopes to grow.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juices, candy, soap, bleach, and rice for her store.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pacca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACCA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María Grimanesa ella es casada y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo e esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz,aceite para su negocio y para algunos gastos personales.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de ganadería, venta de ropa, crianza de animales menores como cuyes, venta de verduras, venta de maiz, crianza de animales, venta de granos secos.

La persona que sale en la foto adjunta es socia que pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Inmaculada Concepción de Pacca Communal Bank; located in the district of Anta in the province of Anta and department of Cusco. 

This member is María Grimanesa. She is 37 years old and married, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities in her grocery store. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, candy, sodas, and other things. She has been working in this business for years, which is going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into every day at her business. 

She works in her business from Monday to Sunday from approximately 6:00 am to 9:00 pm, even though this schedule can vary according to the activities she might have during the day. She is a responsible and determined person, and because she is like this she is able to move her family forward. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise like rice and oil for her business, and for some personal expenses.

The other members make their livings in a cattle business, clothing sales, raising small animals such as guinea pigs, vegetable sales, corn sales, animal raising, and dried grain sales. The person that is in the attached photo is a member who asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work commitments.

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her loan payments in the time period established.

loans.use: with some personal expenses and to buy merchandise like rice and oil for her business

loans.name: Lisbeth Carina

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Lisbeth, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia continúa con su actividad como docente de educación primaria y también en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes vendiendo productos de primera necesidad  y ahora en su nuevo  restaurante donde vende alimentos y bebidas. Lisbeth como en oportunidades anteriores está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes, verduras, menestras, arroz, bebidas, etc. para la producción de su restaurante. Lisbeth está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con sus actividades económica las cuales representan el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The member is Lisbeth, who belongs to the Bank "Los Lideres" of the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is continuing with her work as a primary school teacher and also in her grocery store selling convenience store products, and now in her new restaurant where she sells food and drinks. 

As on previous occasions, Lisbeth is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, legumes, rice, drinks, etc. for food production in her restaurant. 

Lisbeth is very thankful that Kiva allows her to continue with her financial activities, which represent her primary income and the main support for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, legumes, rice, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and commercial maize and sorghum seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow enough food for her family and to use increased profits to send her children to school.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Martha es una integrante del grupo Las Triunfadores el cual esta integrado por 8 personas alegres y trabajadoras cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica. Todas ellas viven en una importante región cañera. Martha estudió hasta la universidad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos ella platica que desde que se convirtió en madre tiene que buscar nuevas oportunidades de trabajo para ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 
Martha se encuentra muy feliz porque desde que inicio con su negocio a sacado adelante a sus hijos y le ofrece a su comunidad un servicio. Ella vende sus productos desde su hogar, espera a que lleguen sus clientes, siempre procura abrir muy temprano "el que madruga Dios lo ayuda". Ademas dice que gracias a Dios ha ido prosperando y con el paso del tiempo  ha ganado mas clientes.
Ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de productos enlatados, pan, aceite, refrescos, jugos, cloro, jabon de baño, jabon de polvo, cloro, detergente, dulces y poder resurtir.
Martha espera que en un futuro su negocio prospere y pueda ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Ana Elizabeth venta de tacos,
Flora servilletas bordadas
Victoria club de nutrición,
Luz María venta de antojitos,
Eduardo micro buses,
Alfonso venta de tacos, 
Judith calzado
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Triumphant Ones) group.  It has eight cheerful, hardworking members each with an economic activity.  They all live in an important sugarcane producing region.  Martha attended university and is a single mother of two children.  She comments that ever since she became a mother she’s needed to find new work opportunities to offer her children a better quality of life.

Martha is very happy because since she started her business she’s moved her children ahead and she provides a service for her community.  She sells products at home.  She waits for customers to come by and always tries to open early.  “God helps the early riser.”  Besides, she says that thanks to God she’s been making progress and in time has won over more customers.

She needs this loan to buy canned goods, bread, oil, soft-drinks, juices, bleach, bath soap, laundry soap, detergent and candy to restock.  Martha hopes in future that the business will prosper and she will be able to provide her children with a better education and quality of life.

The other group members are:

Ana Elizabeth - taco sales,
Flora - embroidered napkins,
Victoria - nutrition club,
Luz María  - fast-food snack sales,
Eduardo - minibus,
Alfonso - taco sales, 
Judith - footwear.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Guadalupe Victoria Group

texts.es:
Abelina es una integrante del grupo Guadalupe Victoria, ella estudio únicamente la secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Misael con quien tiene 2 hijos. Abelina platica que desde que tiene hijos decidió apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar ya que dice que si los dos trabajan pueden sacar adelante y ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Abelina comenta que se encuentra satisfecha con su venta de zapatos ya que desde hace 2 años su negocio ha ido creciendo ya que se ha hecho de algunas clientas. Comenta que realiza su venta de zapatos visitando a sus clientas y vecinas casa por casa, muestra sus zapatos y si a la clienta le gusta le agarra los que le gustan y recibe su pago por ello. Ella ocupara esta inversión para la compra de variedad de zapatos para su posterior venta. Abelina espera que en un futuro su negocio pueda prosperar y  sus ganancias las invertirá en iniciar a vender un poco de ropa tener otra entrada de dinero. Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Imelda venta de antojitos,
Georgina venta de antojitos,
Blanca venta de lencería,
Celia venta de antojitos,
Victoria venta ropa.
texts.en:
Abelina is one of the “Guadalupe Victoria” group members.  She only attended secondary school.  She’s married to Misael and they have two children.  Abelina relates that when she had her children she decided to help her husband with the household expenses; she says that if they both work they can offer their children a better quality of life and move them ahead.  Abelina says that she’s satisfied with her shoe sales and that for the last two years the business has been growing and she’s acquired some customers.  She comments that she sells the shoes visiting her customers and neighbors door to door.  She shows her shoes and if the customer likes them she takes what she likes and she gets paid for them.  She will use this investment to buy a variety of shoes to subsequently sell.  Abelina hopes in future that the business will prosper and she will use her profits to invest in some clothes to sell to have another source of income.  

The other group members are:

Imelda - fast-food sales,
Georgina - fast-food sales,
Blanca - lingerie sales,
Celia - fast-food sales,
Victoria - clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of shoes.

loans.name: Pablo De Jesus

texts.es:
Pablo, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con su esposa y con su madre, quienes dependen económicamente de él, el oficio de Pablo es la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, lo realiza desde las 6:00am hasta las 5:00pm, como un ingreso extra realiza la agricultura sembrando granos básicos, para la alimentación familiar y como fuente de ingresos.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa variada, pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas, entre otras prendas que sean necesarias para atender las demandas de los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el negocio, por la temporada navideña y generar ingresos para la familia.
Su objetivo con el negocio es lograr un mejor futuro para la familia, hacer su propio local fijo de venta.
texts.en:
Pablo earns a living selling clothes. He lives with his wife and her mother, who both depend on him financially. Pablo is a mobile clothes vendor and works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. To earn extra cash, he does agricultural work sowing basic grains to provide food for his family as well as extra income. 

He is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing including pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, and other items to meet his customers' needs. This loan will help him to improve his business during the Christmas season and to create income for his family. His goal is to create a better future for his family through his business and to have his own store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing including pants, shirts, skirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Leon

texts.ru: Леон уже 16 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. Он выращивает ранние огурцы и помидоры, раннюю клубнику. Сейчас Леон готовит теплицы к сезону. Ему нужно закупить пленку, отремонтировать металлический карсас. Леон просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 7,000 гривен. Тепличный бизнес - единственный доход Леона, благодаря которому он содержит свою семью. Поэтому он планирует развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Leon has been greenhouse farming for 16 years.  He grows early cucumbers and tomatoes, and early strawberries.  Right now, Leon is getting the greenhouses ready for the season.  He needs to buy plastic wrap and repair the metal frame.  Leon is asking for a loan of 7,000 hryvnia.  The greenhouse business is Leon's sole source of income, thanks to which he supports his family.  This is why he plans to grow it further.

loans.use: to repair his greenhouse to grow early vegetables

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna was born and lives in Vanadzor city. She is 55 years old. Susanna is a single mother and has a son who now is serving in the Armenian Army. After graduating from school, Susanna worked in different plants in Vanadzor. She had a hard live and raised her son alone. After the Soviet Union period, Susanna ran her own clothes trading business in Vanadzor. She now rents a stall in a one of the biggest Trading Centers in Vanadzor and resells womens clothing, which she buys from Yerevan wholesale markets.
 
Trading business challenging for a single woman, but she does it with her great pleasure and she receives enough money to provide for her small family. Susanna hopes that after her son’s military service, she will be not alone in her hard but profitable business and hopes to develop her trading together with her son.

Susanna needs the 500,000 AMD loan to add to her clothing assortment for big sales on Christmas and New Year.

loans.use: To provide clothing assortment for big sales on Christmas and New Year

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos, pagara mano de obra y una máquina para desgramar el maíz cosechado, esto le ayudara a realizar el proceso de desgramar el maíz para que esté listo para el consumo.
Con el préstamo anterior incremento la productividad de sus cultivos, con ello le ha dado la oportunidad de vender y tener ingresos, los cuales utiliza para los gastos de alimentación en su familia. Gracias a la inversión realizada ha  mejorado sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a new loan to invest in growing basic grains. She will pay labor costs and will purchase a corn sheller to shell the harvested corn. This will help her to shell the corn so that it is ready for consumption. 

With the previous loan, Rosa increased the productivity of her farm and was able to sell her produce and generate income which she used to feed her family. Thanks to the investment she made, she has been able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy a corn sheller.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Jackson put up a small variety store in his family's vicinity which has been running for one year. Jackson and his wife aimed to improve their source of living, so that they will satisfy all their necessities and continue sending their seven children to school. As responsible parents, they want their children to become professionals and have stable jobs.

In this regard, Jackson and his wife agreed to improve their small variety store by increasing their product offerings to satisfy their customers' demands. Due to insufficient capital, Jackson is asking for additional capital of 30,000 KES to buy soft drinks, detergent, soaps, canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages, and flour for sale. He believes that they will improve the business as they continue to work and strive hard.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, detergent, soaps, canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages, and flour for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old. He lives in Kareli District with his wife, two infant children, and his mother and sister. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where tomatoes and cabbages are grown. His sister is a teacher at a local school.  All of the family members work hard, but the income is not enough for covering the everyday expenses. So, John decided to start up a new business. He has requested loans from his local financial institutions several times without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of low income and the lack of experience in the new job, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country, rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, John will build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and construct it. John will plant tomatoes and cabbage seeds in his greenhouse and sell the harvested products locally. This will increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. John awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya is 30-year-old student, who lives in Yerevan with her mother and brother. Sofya studies at Yerevan State Medical College and is in her third course. 
Besides her studies in the college, Sofya works at local clinic as a recorder.  As her salary doesn’t allow her to save money for education, Sofya has applied for this loan. With the requested amount Sofya, would be able to pay for tuition fee for the first semester and continue her study in the college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Lela

texts.en: Lela is 35 years old and lives in Senaki with her husband and three children. Lela works as a nurse at the hospital and her husband is a driver at a private company. Both family members get a small monthly salary. As her income is enough only for food and everyday expenses, Lela decided to start up a new business. She requested a loan from local financial institutions to start trading, but without success. Her loan request was rejected because of her low income and insufficient experience in her business. However, her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. These people do not have access to traditional credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Lela requested a loan to start up a massage room. She has hired the space for her new business and plans to purchase the essential equipment for satisfying the professional needs of masseuses working in her room. This will raise the income of the family, which she will use to improve the family’s living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase essential equipment and start up a massage room

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 20-year-old student who lives in Yerevan with his mother. He studies at Yerevan State University in the faculty of International Relations, and because his mother is the only person in the family who works, it is very difficult for her to cover the family's basic needs and also save money to pay for Andranik’s education.

Andranik has therefore requested this loan to pay his tuition for the first semester. He dreams of becoming a specialist, finding a good-paying job, and insuring a better future for his family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for the first semester.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en: Anzhela is a 20-year old student from Yerevan. Anzhela studies at the Medical University of St. Tereza in Yerevan, in the dental school.  Anzhela lives with her parents.  The only worker in the family is her father.  It is very difficult for them to pay for Anzhela's education. So Anzhela has applied for this loan to pay for tuition for the first semester and to continue her education. She dreams of becoming a good dentist and opening her own clinic.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for the first semester

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel (pictured on the left with his son and brother-in-law) owns a small dairy farm and wants to take advantage of the hundreds of kilograms of waste his cows produce weekly. With his 20-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to use the waste to generate potent organic fertilizer for his animal feed. He will also gain methane-rich biogas, allowing his family to cook and heat bathwater with a renewable resource instead of liquified petroleum gas. This loan represents 43% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 20-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Cristian Darío

texts.en: Cristian (center with his wife and their children), a hog farmer from Mexico State, wants to save money by reducing energy usage on his farm. Due to the energy-intensive nature of meat-processing, Cristian is investing in three 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters to produce the biogas required to shift away from the LP gas he currently uses. His biodigester will also allow him to treat his pig waste, reducing odors, flies, and water contamination. This loan represents 25% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters.

loans.use: To purchase three 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters

loans.name: Cristina Alicia

texts.es: La socia  es la joven Cristina, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia continúa con su actividad en la elaboración de muebles para el hogar y la oficina en su taller de carpintería.  Cristina como en oportunidades anteriores está solicitando el préstamo para comprar materiales como madera, pintura, pegamento y tapicería para la fabricación de sus muebles. Cristina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Meet Cristina, who belongs to the "Los Lideres" [the Leaders] communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She still makes home and office furniture in her carpentry workshop.  As in the past, she is seeking a loan to buy materials such as wood, paint, glue, and upholstery for making furniture.  Cristina is really grateful to Kiva for making it possible to continue her business, which is her family's primary source of income and support.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, paint, glue, and upholstery.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio, comprándose los materiales que son de utilidad como el Maíz, leña, cal, gas, estos los puede comprar a bajo precio si realiza la compra al por mayor y al contado. 
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar el negocio, comprando los productos para seguir elaborando las tortillas, en su familia considera que su económica se mantiene, ha logrado cubrir lo mas necesario.
texts.en:
María is seeking a loan to invest in her business, so she can buy the materials she needs like corn, firewood, lime and gas.  She can get low prices if she buys wholesale and in cash.  

She feels that the prior loan allowed her to improve her business by buying supplies to continue making tortillas, and that she has maintained the family financially, managing to cover the most possible costs.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, and gas.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “El Triunfo” está conformado por amigos, compañeros de trabajo y vecinos que tienen una buena amistad. Los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico, sus paisajes, su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.) 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. 

Bertha tiene 37 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la provincia del Cusco y vive en la misma provincia. Su actividad económica de Bertha es la venta de choclo al por mayor. En esta oportunidad Bertha requiere el préstamo para comprar choclos.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) consists of friends, co-workers, and neighbors who have good rapport. These members live in the city of Cusco, a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historical center, its landscapes, its history, and its reputation of being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The members of this group are hardworking and enterprising individuals. They see each moment as an opportunity to move forward, so they strive each day to provide a better future for their children. Most of these members engage in some type of business activity.

Bertha is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. She was born in Cusco Province and still lives there. Her business involves selling corn wholesale. Bertha is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy corn.

The members appreciate the opportunity that has been given to them, so they promise to complete their payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Medrina

texts.en: Medrina is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. Medrina has been in this business for seven years and has previously received and paid back funds through Kiva. Her goal is to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie works hard to support her family. Lanie is married and has a buying and selling fruit business in the Philippines.

Lanie has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional fruit for the business.

Lanie has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Lanie would like to save money in order to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit for the business.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms Musarat is a 33 year-old married woman. She is a mother of four. 

She has been in the clothing trade business for many years.  She is well known for selling good quality clothes in her community. Most of her neighbors are her clients.  She is making enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a factory but his income is insufficient to bear the daily expenditures of his family members alone. Musarat is significantly contributing to the family income to support her family through all her hard work. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand and highly appreciated among her customers. However, due to low cash in hand she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. Therefore, she has requested a loan of Rs.25, 000 in order to buy a wide variety and large quantity of clothes to add to her new ones. She expects to boost her net income through larger sales.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety and a large quantity of clothes to add to her new ones.

loans.name: Los Luchadores Del Sector C Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Los Luchadores del Sector C. Zoila tiene 42 años, vive con  sus 02 hijos y su pareja, ambos se dedican al comercio. Ella tiene un puesto en un mercado donde vende todo tipo de calzado para damas, caballeros y niños. Su  negocio es muy concurrido, el calzado que ofrece es de muy buena calidad y sus asiduos clientes lo saben muy bien, por eso son leales con ella, con el fruto de su trabajo ha podido adquirir 2 puestos que son de su propiedad, en uno de ellos trabaja su esposo vendiendo productos de limpieza. Zoila se siente feliz porque gracias a su trabajo y mucho esfuerzo está logrando salir adelante junto a su familia, en el futuro desea convertirse en mayorista y  tener una tienda en una buena zona, el nuevo crédito que EDAPROSPO le otorgará lo invertirá en la compra de calzado, quiere estar preparada porque se acercan épocas de muy buena venta.
Zoila quiere decir: ¡Muchas gracias a todos por apoyar a su grupo comunal! 
En la foto ella viste polo en blanco y negro, es la tercera de la izquierda.
*El Sr. Luis aparece al lado derecho de la foto vestido con casaca azul, él también pertenece al grupo.
texts.en: This group is the “Los Luchadores del Sector C” (Sector C Fighters).  Zoila, 42, lives with her two children and her spouse; both of them are merchants.  She has a market stand where she sells all types of footwear for women, men and children.  Her business is very busy because the footwear she offers is very good quality and her regular customers are quite aware of this which is why they are loyal to her.  With the fruits of her labor she’s been able to buy two stands that are now hers; her husband works in one of them selling cleaning supplies.  Zoila feels happy because thanks to her work and much effort she’s managing to move forward with her entire family.  In future, she’d like to become a wholesaler and have a store in a good area.  The new Edaprospo loan will be used to buy footwear because she wants to be ready for the approaching season when sales are very good.  Zoila would like to say: Many thanks to everyone for supporting her communal bank.  In the photo, she’s wearing a black and white shirt; she’s third from the left. Mr. Luis appears on the right hand side of the picture in a blue jacket; he also belongs to the group.

loans.use: to buy shoes that sell in the market

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De Huaycan Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo “Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan”, la cual lleva trabajando más de 01 año, conformada por  personas dinámicas  y responsables. Este es el caso de una de las socias  Marina de 50 años, separada y 02 hijos. Hace 03 años que Marina inicio su propio negocio de la  venta de ceviche en su vivienda. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Su sueño es de construir su casa. Solicito el crédito para la compra de una refrigeradora donde le permita guardar sus productos. Marina agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Marina es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo celeste.
*El joven Richard se adjunta al lado derecho de la fotografía.
texts.en: This is the “Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan” (“Huaycan’s Hope and Progress) Group: it is composed of responsible and dynamic people who have been working together for more than 1 year. Marina is a member of this group: she is 50 years old, she is separated from her husband and she has 2 children. Marina started her own activity 3 years ago, selling “ceviche*” (a Peruvian seafood dish) in her house. Thanks to her efforts she has succeeded in providing for her family. She dreams of having her house built. She is requesting a loan to buy a fridge to store her products. Marina is grateful to Kiva for its support. Marina is the second from the left, wearing a sky blue polo shirt.Richard is on the right hand side of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to store her products.

loans.name: Bikaromat

texts.ru: Бикаромат обратилась в МДО Арванд чтобы  получить кредит для  увеличения своего товарооборота. Она занимается продажей овощей и фруктов.   С декабря начинается  новогодний сезон для этого она хочет увеличить свой капитал и прибыль, чтобы  до нового года она смогла прикупить новый товар.   В настоящее время у нее мало товара и клиентов, чтобы  увеличить свой товар она должна закупить фрукты и овощи.    Бикаромат сама не может ехать за товаром , так как ее возраст и здоровье не позволяет.    В торговле помогает ее дочь, она сама ездит за товаром и привозит заказ матери.  В настоящий момент Бикаромат  хочет получить кредит и планирует закупить товар  бананы, мандарины, яблоки и виноград.   Благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Bikaromat has turned to MDO Arvand for a loan so she can boost her fruit and vegetable vending business.  The holiday season starts in December and she wants to increase capital and profits so she can buy new goods before New Year's.  At present she has few customers and not much produce; she'll need to buy some more fruits and vegetables to stock up.   Because of her age and health, Bikaromat isn't able to go for produce by herself, so her daughter helps her out by going for the produce herself, taking along the order from her mother.  Now Bikaromat would like a loan which she plans to use to buy bananas, tangerines, apples and grapes.  She is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза умная,добросовестная и пунктуальная женщина в возрасте 29 лет, замужем и  имеет троих детей.  Она занимается  продажей продуктов питания.  Наргиза привозит товар с другого города и раздает их по магазинам.    Более 5 лет занимается этим делом и у нее много постоянных клиентов.   Так как спрос на продуктов питания  возросло Наргиза хочет увеличить свой ассортимент товаров.   Поэтому она обратилась в "Арванд" и заранее  благодарит  за поддержку в решениях ее финансовых проблем.
texts.en: Nargiza is an intelligent, honest and punctual woman. She is 29 years old, married and has three children. She sells food products. Nargiza brings goods from other cities and distributes them to local shops. She has more than 5 years of experience in this business and has a lot of regular customers. Given increased demand, Nargiza now wants to diversify her inventory of goods and has turned to "Arvand" to do so. She thanks you in advance for offering support in the resolution of her financial problems.

loans.use: Buy more food supplies

loans.name: Batokani

texts.fr: Âgée de 48 ans, Batokani est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Elle fait des beignets qu’elle vend à la maison et y ajoute également le commerce de céréales. Son activité implique un membre de sa famille qui le seconde pour lui faciliter la tache. Elle sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour l’achat de céréales afin de renforcer son commerce de beignets et de céréales. Elle veut agrandir son activité et diversifier sa marchandise. Elle s’investit pour aider son mari à  assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Batokani is 48 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She makes beignets [fritters], which she sells at her home, and additionally sells cereals. Her business involves a member of her family who assists her to make her work easier.

Batokani is seeking her second loan from WAGES for the purchase of cereals in order to strengthen her business selling beignets and cereals. She wants to expand her business and diversify her wares. She is dedicated to her work in order to help her husband see to the basic needs of their family.

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sikilo   est né depuis la création du banc villageois portant le même nom en 1998. Il est composé de 27 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Fatoumata, (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 27ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants : 03 garçons et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans le commerce de patate qu’elle paie à 3500 F CFA le sac et le sac de manioc à 6000 F CFA. 
Elle s’approvisionne à partir des villages environnant pour la revente dans sa localité respectivement à 6000 FCFA  le sac de patate, 8000 FCFA  le sac de manioc. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Avec les bénéfices que cette activité génère, elle compte dans le futur renforcer son épargne aider son mari dans les taches régaliennes (dépenses), assurer la scolarité des enfants et leurs soins.
texts.en:
The Sikilo Group was born with the creation of a banc villageois bearing the same name in 1998. It is made up of 27 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary activity is small business.

Mrs. Fatoumata (seated at far right [in the photo]) is the group's featured borrower. She is 27 years old, married and the mother of four children, three boys and one girl. She participates in the sale of potatoes, for which she pays 3,500 CFA francs per sack, and 6,000 CFA francs per sack of manioc. She gets her supplies from the local surrounding villages, which she then sells for 6,000 CFA francs per sack of potatoes and 8,000 CFA francs per sack of manioc. She benefits from her experience in this business, which she has been involved in for years.

With the profits that this business generates, Mrs. Fatoumata plans to increase her savings in the future to help her husband with various expenses and to provide for her children's school fees and care.

loans.use: To obtain sacks of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sorbets and a cooler.

loans.name: Elias Ismael

texts.es:
Elías, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, él se dedica a la venta y reparación de motocicletas, el negocio es propio, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00am hasta las 6:00pm.
Solicita un préstamo porque necesita la adquisición de repuestos, como catarinas, frenos, pedales, entre otros que son los que utiliza para reparar las motocicletas, este préstamo le dará los recursos necesarios para tener más abastecido el negocio.
Su objetivo a través del préstamo, es tener la capacidad para atender la demanda de los clientes, en su hogar, pues velara por mejorar la calidad de vida de los miembros.
texts.en:
Elias, who lives with his mother and siblings, sells and repairs motorcycles. The business is his own, and he works from 6 am to 6 pm.

He is requesting a loan because he needs to get spare parts such as sprocket wheels, brakes, pedals, and other items that he uses to repair motorcycles. This loan will give him the means to better supply his business.

With this loan, his goal is to have the ability to meet his customers' demand from his location. Through this, he is looking to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase sprocket wheels, brakes, and pedals.

loans.name: Hector Damian

texts.es:
Héctor, vive con su madre, es hijo único, ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar, él es comerciante de ropa y hamacas, su intensión con el negocio es crear una fuente de trabajo e ingresos, trabaja desde las 6:00am hasta las 6:00pm.
Hector quiere invertir en la compra de mercadería, blusas, faldas, hamacas, para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita mejorar el negocio, adquiriendo mas mercadería.
La aspiración de él es a través de su trabajo poder crear una mejor condición de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
Hector, who lives with his mother and is an only child, helps his mother with the household expenses. He sells clothes and hammocks. His plan for the business is to create a source of work and income. He works from 6 am to 6 pm.

Hector wants to invest (this loan) in the purchase of merchandise, blouses, skirts, and hammocks so he is requesting a loan that will allow him to improve his business, acquiring more merchandise.

His goal is to, through working, create better living conditions in his home.

loans.use: purchase merchandise, blouses, skirts, and hammocks.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José, tiene 47 años de edad, está casado, posee dos hijos uno de ellos estudia y le ayuda José a trabajar, la ocupación es un taller de estructuras metálicas, tiene 20 años de existir, lo aprendió de su padre, tiene dos empleados y realiza trabajos a domicilio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de un equipo de soldar, esto le ayudara a mejorar su maquinaria, realizando con más eficiencia su trabajo.
La aspiración de José es fortalecer el taller, para realizar mejor los trabajos, con ello poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 47 years old, married and has two children, one of whom goes to school and helps José with his work. José makes a living as a metal-smith and has had a workshop for 20 years. He learned the trade from his father. He has two employees and works at home. He is requesting the loan to purchase a welding machine, which will help him improve his machinery and do his work more efficiently. José's hope is to strengthen his workshop to better carry out his work, which will help him be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 4600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Gloria is aware that by using the solar lamp that she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married mother of four, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and banana vending. Aileen is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, etc for her furniture making business.

Delia has been in this business for 8 years; she earns more income from duck-raising.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, etc for her furntiture making business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina earns a living through her sari-sari, or variety store business. She sells various goods to the people in her location in Talibon, Bohol.

Marcelina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, dry goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, Marcelina hopes to attract more customers and buyers for her store.

In the future, Marcelina aims to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, dry goods, snack foods, and toiletries to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Dioseta

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Dioseta works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Dioseta is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more recycled materials for her buying and selling recycled materials business.

Dioseta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials for her buying and selling recycled materials business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 31 year old married woman and a mother of four young children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income.

Mercedita is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for storage. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Mercedita hopes to expand their business and saves money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for storage

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Florenda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Florenda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Florenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her general store like canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF (KIVA's field partner in the region) to buy products like soap, shampoo, canned goods, and groceries to sell in her store.

Gloria has been in this business for 12 years, and raises pigs on the side for extra income. Gloria sustains her businesses through hard work, and with the support of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure a solid future for her family.

loans.use: to buy products like soap, shampoo, canned goods, and groceries, for her general store.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, she previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan in order to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia hopes to be able to expand soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

** Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
This is Emelita, 47 years-old, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Luisito, a government employee, and is mother to her  children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Emelita operates a vegetable growing farm. She grows vegetables and other fruits in their farm located in Cavite.  The farm is in the highlands where it is suitable to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her products to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan in order to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emelita dreams to be able to give her all her family a good future and dreams to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan in order to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Regina hopes to expand her business. She dreams of giving her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita took out and repaid a prior loan for 15,000 PHP which she used to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle and to pay for maintenance. Her income has been a big help in paying for the education of her children and in meeting personal, household and business expenditures.  She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy more spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her vehicle. The additional profit she earns will help her meet the needs of her family and pay for the education of her children. She looks forward to this with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Her goal for the future is to give her family a good life and succeed in business. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and study religion.*

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. Groups are made up of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicle and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy scrap for her husband's scrap selling business.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 51 years old and married with seven children. Two of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

Melba has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, diapers, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Melba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 43 years old, married with three children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Grace has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like sugar, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Mary Grace has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DEMBAGNOUMA  est constitué de 5 femmes mariées, 1 veuve et 1 célibataire ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 05 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhèrent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des habits et de friperie. 
HABY, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première femme  de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de friperie et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 colis de friperies avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The DEMBAGNOUMA group is made up of five married women, one widow, and one single; their average age is 38 years old and an average of five children. A majority of the women live in traditional families in the Massablacoura quarter in Bougouni. 

They are known across the lines of neighborhood, friendship, and trade. To reinforce their financial capacity in order to better their business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso  and this will be their first loan. The group of women is in the business of selling clothing and second-hand clothing. She will buy the used clothing to be purchased with this loan, one package of clothing from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes sales at the market and at home in cash and credit to a clientele made of men and women.  She expects to make an average of 15.000FCFA which will be invested in the business activities and payback the loan.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Mavtuna

texts.ru: Мавтуна молодая, красивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 20 лет. Она еще не замужем и живет с родителями. Доход ее родителей не было достаточно, чтобы она поступила в университет и получила высшее образование. Она обучилась на курсе шитье и кройки и научилась шить национальные женские платья. Теперь Мавтуна хочет получать доход от своего ремесла и стать успешной бизнес леди будущим. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес услугой швеи, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Ее рабочий цех будет возле ее дома и уже ее соседки обещали ей быть постоянными клиентками, так как она шьет очень аккуратно и красиво. От полученного дохода она планирует помогать родителям для улучшения условия проживания.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и материалов, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavtuna is a young, beautiful and ambitious woman. She is 20 years old, not married and lives with her parents. Her parents could not afford to send her to a university, so she has completed a sewing class and learned how to sew traditional women's dresses. Now Mavtuna wants to become a successful business woman and earn income from her craft. She has received a certificate for completing the "Get Ahead" course offered by the National Association of Business Women. She can now start a business and become successful in this field. She wants to offer sewing services, because she has experience in this kind of business. Her sewing shop will be close to her house, and her neighbors have already promised to be regular customers since her work is very neat and beautiful. She plans to use her earnings to help parents improve their living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and materials to establish a new business. She's waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics for start a new business

loans.name: Herculano Engelberto

texts.es:
