Herculano, vive con su madre, con su esposa y un hijo, él y su hijo trabajan la carpintería, además se dedican a la elaboración de hamacas, con el crédito anterior compro madera y suministros para el trabajo, por el momento necesita dinero para la compra de madera para completar la elaboración de un chinero, tambien se comprara un torno eléctrico.
Con la compra de esta herramienta Herculano no tendrá que ir a otro lugar a tornar su madera (decorarla), le ahorrara tiempo y costos, por esta razón quiere invertir en esta compra; actualmente tiene un objetivo y es instalar un sala venta de diferentes muebles, apoyando a su hijos en la enseñanza para que sea un empresario.
texts.en:
Herculano lives with his mother, his wife, and a son. He and his son work in carpentry. In addition, they make hammocks. With the previous loan, he bought wood and supplies for his work. At this time he needs money to purchase wood to complete the construction of a china cabinet. He will also buy an electric lathe.

With the purchase of this tool, Herculano will not have to go to another place to turn his wood (to decorate it). He will save time and expenses. For this reason he wants to invest in this purchase. Now he has a goal, which is to set up a sales room with different furniture, encouraging his son by teaching him to be an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy wood and an electric lathe.

loans.name: Jessica Albertina

texts.es:
Jessica, tiene 21 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad, vive en casa propia, cultiva granos básicos junto con su esposo para obtener ingresos y mantener el hogar, tiene 4 años de trabajar en esta actividad.
Actualmente está realizando la siembra de hortalizas, para esto necesita comprarse  abono y herbicidas, para cultivar tomates, pipián y frijoles, por eso solicita un préstamo que le sea útil para invertir en el cultivo y tener una buena producción.
La aspiración de Jessica es mantener a sus hijos con lo necesario, crecerlos con educación para que sean mejores personas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 21 years old, has two children who are two and one years old, lives in her own home, and grows staple foods with her husband as a means of generating income and supporting the household. She has been in this line of work for four years.

It is now vegetable-planting time, and so she needs to buy fertilizer and weedkillers in order to grow tomatoes, squash, and beans. Because of this, she is requesting a loan that will be used to invest in farming and having a good harvest.

Jessica's goal is to give her children all that they need and provide them with a good education so they can be better people.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and weedkillers.

loans.name: Merlinia

texts.es:
Merlinia de 21 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en un distrito rural.
Merlinia es carismática y empeñosa. Se encarga de apoyar a sus padres en el trabajo del campo.
Hace 2 años le heredaron una parcela de terrenos, ahí siembra papas, habas, arvejas y maíz. Así empezó pero se dio cuenta que sembrar un producto es más rentable por la cantidad de la cosecha, por eso este año cultivó papas, las que vendió con éxito.
Esta vez quiere sembrar maíz y flores de gladiolos porque el clima y el mes son propicios para conseguir buenos frutos y ganancias.
Mientras tanto se dedica al cuidado de sus animales, de los que también obtiene ingresos; como por ejemplo de la venta de leche y quesos que elabora. Merlinia es constante en sus actividades.
Esta vez requiere de su ayuda para adquirir más abono para iniciar una siembra de maíz y flores de gladiolos. Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP. Esta agradecida por la confianza una vez más y no duda en pagar las cuotas con responsabilidad. Le agrada l trabajo con su banco comunal “Las Estrellitas”.
Con los 800 soles podrá adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico para iniciar nuevas siembras de maíz y flores de gladiolos.
texts.en: Merlinia is a 21-year-old hardworking young woman. She lives with her parents in a rural district. She is charismatic and earnest. She supports her parents by working in the fields. Two years ago, she inherited a plot of land where she grows potatoes, lima beans, peas and corn. Once she started, she realized that a product is more lucrative when a larger quantity is harvested, so this year she grew potatoes, which she sold with success. This time she wants to plant corn and flowers because the climate and the month is right for good products and profits. Meanwhile, she also makes a living caring for livestock. For example, she sells milk and cheeses that she makes. Merlinia is constant in her activities and is requesting a loan to help her acquire more fertilizer to start planting corn and flowers. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is grateful for the confidence in her once again and has no doubts that she will make her payments responsibly. She enjoys working with her "Las Estrellitas" community bank. With the loan, she will be able to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer to begin her plantings.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la tienda, comprando productos de la canasta básica como pan, azúcar, aceite, sal, condimentos, entre otros que le darán un mejor beneficio surtiendo el negocio para atender las demandas de los clientes.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar la mercadería que ofrece en el negocio, con esto se ha mantenido, gracias a la buena inversión con el préstamo Kiva, ha podido mantener a su hogar con lo necesario.
texts.en: María is requesting a new loan to invest in her store, purchasing basic products like bread, sugar, oil, salt, condiments and other items that will provide a major benefit by stocking her store and tending to her customers' demands. She says the previous loan helped her improve the merchandise in her store and help maintain her business. Thanks to a good investment with the Kiva loan, she has been able to provide her home with necessities.

loans.use: to purchase bread, sugar, oil, salt and condiments.

loans.name: Teodora Veronica

texts.es:
Teodora, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la mercadería para la tienda, comprado cereales, pastas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros productos básicos para brindar un mejor servicio  a los clientes.
Ella mejoro sus ingresos con la inversión que le realizo al negocio, a través del préstamo financiado por Kiva anteriormente, esto le ha permitido mejorar y suplir algunas deudas, y siempre invertir en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Teodora is requesting a new loan to invest in merchandise for her store.  She will purchase cereals, pastas, rice, beans, and sugar as well as other basic products, which will allow her to offer better service to her clients.  She was able to increase her income by improving her business with her previous loan, which also allowed her payoff some debt and to continue to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, pastas, rice, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, está administrando al mismo tiempo de la venta de semilla marañón una carpintería y necesita comprar madera para realizar muebles, se comprara madera de diferentes clases, clavos, tornillos, pinturas, barniz, todo esto forma parte de la materia prima para la carpintería. 
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue una mejoría en el funcionamiento del negocio, invirtiendo en la temporada de la semilla de marañón, con ello ha podido mejorar el sustento de la familia y compro material para mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria has decided to apply for a new loan. She is presently administering 2 activities; selling cashew seeds, and operating a carpentry shop, for which she needs to buy wood for making furniture. She will purchase wood of different types, nails, screws, paint, and varnish. All this forms a part of the primary materials she needs to do her carpentry work.

The result of her previous loan was to improve the functioning of her business, investing in cashew seeds to sell during season. With that loan she has been able to better sustain her family and, also, purchase material to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase wood of different classes, nails, screws, paint, and varnish so that she can make furniture.

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth, solicita un préstamo para aumentar el nivel de inventario de su negocio de meriendas, se comprara maíz, aceite, gas y condimentos, así como algunos vegetales y otros productos que le ayudan a realizar el negocio. 
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, aplico el dinero en el negocio, aumentando su capacidad para producir y vender, sus ingresos familiares han sido estables para cubrir los gastos mas necesarios.
texts.en:
Ruth is seeking a loan to increase inventory for her snack business.  She'll buy corn, oil, gas, and condiments like vegetables and other helpful items.

Ruth enjoyed a positive impact from her prior loan.  She put the money toward the business, increasing production and sales capacity.  Her family's income has become stable enough to cover the most necessary costs.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, gas and condiments.

loans.name: Elsi Noemi

texts.es:
Elsi, administra su crianza de cerdos, necesita realizar una compra de dos cerdos y tres quintales de concentrado para alimentarlos, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la inversión, logrando aumentar la granja.
Ella quiere aumentar sus ingresos, pues considera que los préstamos le permiten comprar alimentación, vestuario y otras necesidades básicas de su hogar y sus familiares, considera que esta superándose, ha enviado a sus hijos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Elsi manages her hog business and needs to buy two more pigs and three bushels of feed for them.  She is asking for a loan that will allow her to make this investment and expand her farm.

She wants to increase her income and feels that the loans will allow her to buy food, clothing, and other basic needs for her home and family.  She feels that she’s succeeding and has been able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 54 years old and widowed with eight children. Three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cerila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Cerila has been in this business for 24 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feed, soft rinks, beverages, canned goods and other groceries. 

She hopes to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
For more than ten years now, Perfecta and her husband have operated a fishing business together. They live in Talibon, Bohol in the Phillipines, along with their 8 young children.

Perfecta is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and buckets. These supplies will help her husband increase his daily catch, which means more fish for the two of them to sell in the market. In the future, Perfecta hopes to grow and improve their business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and buckets.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josefa works hard to support her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and raises pigs for extra income. Josefa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF (Kiva's field partner in the region) to purchase more products like soap, soft drinks, canned goods, and sugar to sell in her store.

Josefa has received support for her business through five previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, and other products for her general store

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms. Safia is a 33-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of three children. She has a business of making artificial flowers for decorating homes and rooms for special occasions like weddings, parties, etc. She has gained six years of experience in this field. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a farmer, but he does not earn enough to support his family well.

She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 25000 to buy raw materials such as papers, ribbons, paints in different colors, and clippers to keep up with the increasing demand. Her dream is to run a small manufacturing unit and engage poor females from the community in her business. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as papers, ribbons, paints in different colors, and clippers to keep up with increasing demand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth, thread for handicrafts business

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Ms. Kausar is a 32-year-old married woman. She is efficiently running a small general store outside her house. She has been in this business for the past five years.  Her husband assists her in buying grocery items from the market. She is contributing to the family income to fulfill the needs of the eight family members. 

Kausar shared that taking a loan from Kashf helped her make investments she never thought she would be able to. Her shop recently went through expansion. Currently she is requesting a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase more grocery items such as grains, flour, sugar, and beverages. Purchasing this stock will allow her to continue to meet customers’ demands. Kausar intends to spend part of her profits on her family well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as grains, flour, sugar and beverages

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
This is Melania. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase products like clothing, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 10,000 PHP to buy additional supplies of raw materials like thread, fabric, and other materials needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Melania hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms Rehana is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been in business of sewing for many years. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques. 

She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine.  At present, she enjoys a great client list and gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy spools of thread, and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors. Then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. 

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads, and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors for her sewing business.

loans.name: Khishigdavaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Khishigdavaa, 47 years old, lives with her husband and only son, age of 21. She has been working for thirteen years in a carpet enterprise in Orkhon Aimag as an assistant weaver. Her husband works privately as a construction carpenter. Their son has just begun five months ago to work in the MBS HD television enterprise as an assistant producer and cameraman. 

As winter comes to Mongolia, they are in need of a heater and construction materials to build their incomplete barn, as well as changing their house’s wooden roof to an iron roof. So Khishigdavaa is requesting the loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy the above mentioned products. By doing so, the house will reduce heat loss and consumption of coal, which is used widely in Mongolia as a primary source for heating. Its consumption is one of the main factors for air pollution. 

Khishigdavaa is a very hardworking individual and she believes one day their living standard will improve. She has a dream of leaving their house to their only son.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for house heating.

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Ms. Shahzadi is a 28-year-old married woman. She is the mother of one child. Three years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. 

She buys clothes of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. Most of her clients are her neighbors.  She has gradually improved her business, and now she requested a loan of Rs. 15,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes for the winter season in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. 

She intends to use the earned profits on her home’s renovation.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of clothes for the winter season in a larger quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of frozen food and processed meat. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of frozen food and processed meat. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Victoria hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional processed meat and frozen food needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Charito requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is single and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Evelyn sells dresses, jeans and shirts at Akatakyiwa, which she has done since last year. She has no husband. Evelyn uses her income to take care of herself and her children. Evelyn will use the loan to purchase dresses, jeans and shirts to sell. She will use it to expand her business by buying a variety of clothing. Evelyn then plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, jeans and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms. Perveen is a 50-year-old married woman. She is a businesswoman of good repute and has run a cloth stitching business for 5 years. She buys cloth of different colors from the market and stitches it to make bed sheets and trousers for the people of her community. She started this business with the motive to help her husband in order to overcome financial problems, and now she is in a situation to further increase her business. She needs more investments to purchase raw materials such as bundles of cloth in different designs and colors with packs of threads and zippers. With this in mind, she applied a loan of Rs. 35,000, and her case has been approved by Kashf Foundation. She has two sons and one daughter. Her son also helps her with her business, and she wishes to improve her earnings for providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as bundles of cloths in different designs and colors with packs of threads and zippers.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice operates a grocery shop in Akatakyiwa. Eunice has received schooling through junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. Eunice has been selling provisions since last year. She is responsible for supporting her husband, taking care of her children and the family’s expenses as well. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of groceries for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to enlarge it.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries for resale

loans.name: Panua Akili Group

texts.en:
Edrick's group has 24 farmers and is located in Lugari District. Edrick is pictured on the right of Panua Akili Group with her hand raised. Edrick is a returning One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season.  She joined One Acre Fund in 2012 in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to learn technical farming skills. Prior to being a member of One Acre Fund, Edrick averaged 4 bags per 1/2 acre.  In her 1/2 acre OAF maize plot last year, she harvested 8 bags.

Edrick described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school and perhaps investing in another business. She has also indicated her desire to continue working with One Acre Fund. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Edrick’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 12 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is single and has six dependents. She has no educational background. Ama sells Accra kenkey [a dish made with cornmeal] at Akatakyiwa, which she has done for 3 years. Ama is not married. She uses her income to take care of her six children. Ama will use the loan to purchase more maize in order to help her prepare more Accra kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize in order to help her prepare more Accra kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is widow and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Veronica sells gari and bowls at Akatakyiwa, which she has done since last year. Her husband is dead. Veronica uses her income to cater for her two children. Veronica will use the loan to buy more gari and bowls for resale. With the new profits, veronica plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to buy more gari and bowls for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  is married and has two children. She has no formal education but earns a living by selling sugar cane in the town of Akatakyiwa. She has done this for the last four years while her husband earns a living as a farmer. Efua uses her income to support her family and care for her children. She will use this loan to expand her business by selling gari, a popular local dish made of cassava. Her goal for the future is to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to go into the business of selling gari, a popular local dish made of cassava.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah sells banku, rice and yam at Akatakyiwa. Hannah has no educational background.  She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a mason. Hannah has been selling banku, rice and yam for eight years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in taking care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava dough for preparing banku and to buy more rice and yams. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to  buy more cassava dough, rice and yams.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Paulina sells Accra kenkey at Akatakyiwa, which she has done since last year. Her husband is a carpenter. Paulina uses her income to help her husband, take care of the children and other family duties. Paulina will use the loan to purchase more maize to help her prepare more Accra kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Paulina plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to help her prepare more Accra kenkey to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads, thread and other material for embriodery business

loans.name: Slava

texts.en: Slava is 45 years old. He lives in the Senaki District with his wife and daughter. Slava works as an artisan locally and gets a monthly income. But the income is not enough to cover the family's everyday expenses. So, Slava decided to start a new business. He has requested loans from his local financial institutions several times without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of low income and the lack of experience in the new job, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country, rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, Slava will build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and construct it. Slava will plant different kinds of vegetables seeds in his greenhouse and sell the harvested products locally. This will increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Slava awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Princesitas Del Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRINCESITAS DEL AMOR”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de lácteos, venta de café, venta de verduras, venta de refrescos, venta de comida, venta de regalos, trenzado de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Claudia es parte integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que la visitó en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos, cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió recientemente con los ahorros que tenía en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrescos) que adquirirá de las embotelladoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Princesitas del Amor” (Little Princesses of Love) is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Claudia as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling dairy products, selling coffee, selling vegetables, selling soft drinks, selling food, selling gifts, and weaving blankets.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs in various trades, such as Sra. Claudia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter who came to her house. At the moment, she has a soft drink business that she started recently with the savings she accumulated through Pro Mujer.

The loan Claudia is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying soft drinks. She acquires her products from bottlers and then sells them from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her household. Claudia is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Claudia said that she enjoys the training seminars about credit and health issues.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила 20 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. Она выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы, помидоры, раннюю клубнику. Имея большой опыт, Людмила успешно ведет бизнес. У нее есть постоянные покупатели, которым сдает товар оптом. Людмиле нужен кредит для закупки семян и новой пленки для теплиц. Людмила - ответственная и пунктуальная. Она намерена расширять свое тепличное хозяйство в дальнейшем.
texts.en: Ludmilla has practiced greenhouse farming for twenty years.  She grows cucumbers, tomatoes and strawberries.  Because she has much experience, she runs her business successfully.  She has consistent clientele, that buys her harvests in bulk.  Ludmilla needs credit to purchase seeds and plastic to make greenhouses.  Ludmilla is accountable and punctual.  She intends on expanding her greenhouse business in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and plastic to make greenhouses.

loans.name: Dilbaroi

texts.ru: Дилбар  с большим  опытом работы в сфере торговли, продает продукты питания ежедневного потребления на центральном рынке.У неё много клиентов и она постепенно расширяет свой товарооборот.Первый её кредит был небольшого размера и она использовав его выгодно получила прибыль.С тех пор Дилбар непрерывно получает кредит и её активы намного увеличились.У неё двое  детей и они тоже поддерживают её в бюджете семьи.Её муж нигде не работает и Дилбарой с сыновьями работают и зарабатывают на жизнь.Сейчас  у неё налаженный, стабильный бизнес и она решила на полученный кредит  купить одного теленка на откорм, чтобы зимой зарезать его и прокормить свою семью.   Она рада, что сотрудничает с Арванд и благодарит за поддержку .
texts.en: Dilbaroi has extensive experience in retail, selling food at the central market.  She has many clients and is gradually expanding her turnover. She used her first small loan to successfully earn an income. Since then, she has been continuously taking out loans, and her assets have increased considerably. Her husband is not working, so Dilbar and her two children work to support the family. Her business is currently well-established and stable; she has decided to use this loan to buy a calf that she will fatten and butcher during the winter to feed her family. She is glad to work with Arvand and is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy calf

loans.name: Dutsimbatare Group

texts.fr:
Rémegie fait partie du groupe Dutsimbatare et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de  60 ans .Elle a 2 enfants le cadet a 16 ans et l’aîné 20 ans.

Elle  fait le  commerce  de tomates, et de  bière de banane  depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de tomates et de bananes pour préparer la bière de banane, à vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de satisfaire les besoins familiaux (alimentation, soins de santé,…).
texts.en:
Rémegie is part of the Dutsimbatare group and lives in Gitega. She is widowed and 60 years old. She has 2 children, the youngest is 16 and the oldest is 20.

She has sold tomatoes and banana beer for the past 20 years.

She is on her thirteenth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is taking, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes and bananas to prepare banana beer to sell to make more money. 

The profit from her sales allows her to meet her family's needs (food, health care, etc).

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of tomatoes and bananas to make banana beer to sell

loans.name: Maria Fredelvinda

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de lociones y administra una sala de belleza, vive con sus hijos ya adultos y con su esposo, los hijos tienen la edad de 22, 24, 30 años, dos dependen aun de María y su esposo. El negocio de María lo inicio por necesidad de llevar el sustento a su familia, a través de estudios aprendió la cosmetología. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de belleza, maquillaje, labiales, cremas, lociones de diferentes fragancias, esto ayudara a mejorar el negocio y podrá mejorar su servicio.
La aspiración que tiene María con el negocio, es recibir los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, que la calidad de vida de cada uno de ellos sea mejor.
texts.en:
Maria sells lotions and runs a beauty salon. She lives with her children, who are already adults, and her husband. Her children are ages 22, 24, and 30. Two still depend on Maria and her husband. Maria began her business because of the need to provide for her family. She learned cosmetology by studying.

She is applying for a loan to purchase beauty products, makeup, lipsticks, creams, and lotions of different fragrances. This will help her improve her business, and she will be able to improve her service.

Maria's goal for her business is to receive the income she needs for her household, so that the quality of life of each one of them will be better.

loans.use: to buy makeup, lipsticks, creams, and lotions

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
Jhonatan de 20 años es un joven soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres, ubicada en un anexo agrícola.
Jhonatan es un joven con muchas ganas de vivir y trabajar. Se dedica a la agricultura en los terrenos de sus padres. Cultiva papas, arvejas, flores de gladiolos, principalmente.
Al lado de sus padres y hermanos van hacia sus terrenos que están a gran distancia de su vivienda. “Cuando hay mucho trabajo tenemos que ir varias personas, me gusta el campo, pero también ahorro para poder estudiar”, menciona emocionado.
Antes no tenía el apoyo económico para realizar su labor con independencia, pero está muy agradecido de formar parte de su banco comunal. “Ahora si podré trabajar con tranquilidad”, agrega.
El requiere de su apoyo para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes y semillas para iniciar una siembra de papas y maíz. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP. Ésta agradecido por el apoyo de su banco comunal “Las Estrellitas”, por al oportunidad de desarrollo.
Él necesita 1500 soles para comprar semillas de maíz y papas, así como bolsas de fertilizantes para estos cultivos.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is 20 years old, a single young man. He lives in his parents' home, which is located in an agricultural annex.

Jhonatan is a young man with big dreams for living and working. He works in agriculture on his parents' land. He grows potatoes, peas, and gladiola flowers, mainly.

Along with his parents and siblings, he goes to the farmland, which is very far from where they live. "When there is a lot of work, several of us have to go. I like the countryside, but I also like to be able to study," he says excitedly.

Before, he didn't have the economic support to work independently, but he is very grateful to be part of a communal bank. "Now I will be able to work peacefully," he adds.

He needs your support to get bags of fertilizer and seeds in order to start planting potatoes and corn. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP.

He is grateful for the help of his communal bank, "Las Estrellitas" (The Little Stars) and the opportunity to grow.

He needs 1,500 soles to purchase corn seeds and potatoes, as well as bags of fertilizer for his farming.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds and potatoes as well as bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales a utilizar en la siembra de granos básicos, adquiriendo abono y pago de mano de obra, que será lo más importante para que él realice su trabajo en el campo.
Manifiesta que su experiencia con los prestamos ha sido buena, realizando su trabajo todos los días, tambien comenta que en este tiempo ha comprado un vehículo para trasladar la cosecha al mercado, gracias al crédito financiado por KIVA, hoy tiene mayor capacidad y mejoras económicas en su familia.
texts.en: Luis is requesting a loan to purchase materials for growing basic grains, such as fertilizer, and paying for labor, which will be the most important part of carrying out his work in the field. He says his experience with the loans has been good, helping him with his work every day, and he also says that he has purchased a vehicle to transport his harvest to market. Thanks to loans from Kiva, today he has more ability and more money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Dolores Armida

texts.es:
Dolores, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para darle continuidad al negocio, realizando las ventas de frutas y verduras, ella se comprara tomates, cebollas, papas, zanahorias, repollos, rábanos y aguacates, con esto tendrá más oportunidades para realizar sus ventas.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo un efecto positivo pues mejoro su negocio, con lo que pudo mejorar sus ventas en este periodo; su deseo es seguir ampliándose en el mercado, de los recursos económicos poder ayudar a su familia y realizar mejoras a la viviendas.
texts.en: Dolores decided on a new loan so she can continue with her business selling fruits and vegetables. She plans to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, carrots, radishes and avocados, which will give her more opportunities to make her sales. Her previous loan had a positive effect on her business and helped her increase her sales in this period. Her goal is to keep expanding her market to have financial resources to be able to help her family and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, radishes and avocados.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Ronald Antonio

texts.es:
Ronald, quiere invertir más en la ganadería, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra de dos terneras, concentrado, para el ganado lechero, esto ayudara a que él continúe incrementando su hato ganadero. 
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, le ayudo a mejorar su ganado, su situación en la familia es mucho mejor, aunque el número de miembros no ha aumentado.
texts.en:
Ronald would like to invest in more cattle. He's seeking a loan that will allow him to buy calves and feed concentrate for his dairy, so he can continue to grow his herd.

The prior loan had a positive impact and helped him improve the herd.  His family's situation is much better, although its size has not increased.

loans.use: to buy calves and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, necesita invertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de pollo, aceite, condimentos, cubitos, con esto tendrá la capacidad para realizar más venta de pollo dorado, ya que diariamente lo realiza. 
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió realizar una buena compra, de la cual hasta el momento ha incrementado sus ganancias, sus hijos han seguido estudiando, esta agradecida por este aporte, que mejora económicamente su vida y fortalece el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana needs to invest in her business, so she is requesting a loan so that she can buy chicken, oil, condiments, and seasoning cubes. The loan will give her the capacity to sell more fried chicken on a daily basis.

Ana says that her previous loan enabled her to make a large purchase, which has helped to increase her earnings to date. Her children are continuing their studies. Ana is grateful for this support, which has helped her to improve financially in life and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, condiments, and seasoning cubes.

loans.name: Ana Agustina

texts.es:
Ana, necesita comprar mercadería para la venta de las pupusas, ella recibió una buena atención en el préstamo anterior, que la motiva a seguir trabajando, se comprara repollo, aceite, tomates, condimentos, carne, con esto seguirá realizando sus ventas.
Ella manifiesta que con el aporte del préstamo anterior, mejoro sus ventas, la clientela han aumentado, le ha servido para mantener a sus hijos con lo necesario en el hogar, su aspiración es poder continuar ayudando a la superación de la familia, estos crédito le ayudan a mejorar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana needs to buy merchandise to sell pupusas. She received good customer services during her previous loan, which motivated her to continue working. She will buy cabbage, oil, tomatoes, condiments and meat so that she can continue making sales. 

She says that thanks to her previous loan, she improved her sales and increased her clients, and it helped her to support her children with the necessary things at home. She hopes to be able to continue helping her family get ahead, and these loans help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, oil, tomatoes, condiments and meat.

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.es:
Rosa, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería e incrementar las ventas, adquiriendo un lote de medicinas naturales, como linaza, manzanilla, vitaminas, antibióticos, elaborados con hierbas, con esto tendrá la capacidad para salir a vender.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener medicamentos necesarios para atender las demandas y necesidades de los clientes, sus circunstancias familiares han mejorado con los ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa decided to request a new loan in order to buy a lot of natural medicines, such as linseed, chamomile, vitamins, antibiotics, and herbal products so that she can increase her sales.  These items will allow her to go out and sell.

She says that her previous loan allowed her to grow and have the necessary products on hand to meet her customers’ needs.  Her family situation has also improved with her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: José

texts.es: José con su anterior credikiva, invirtió en la adecuación de su puesto de trabajo y en la compra de algunas herramientas como tester y taladros. Su credikiva lo benefició mucho porque la imagen de su negocio mejoró y aumentó la calidad de sus trabajos, con las nuevas herramientas, por eso se incrementaron sus ventas. Desde que recibió su crédito su vida familiar mejoró porque ahora recibe más ingresos, para apoyar mucho más los gastos familiares. Él envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : Estoy muy agradecida  ya que me permitieron mejorar mis condiciones de trabajo, con una mejor infraestructura y mejores herramientas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará Parlantes para vehículos, cable eléctrico para radios convencionales; su inversión tendrá éxito porque cuenta con clientes que demandan estos artículos.
texts.en:
With José's previous "CrediKiva" loan, he invested in fixing up his work space and buying certain tools, like testers and drills. His CrediKiva helped him a lot, because he improved the appearance of his business and the quality of his work thanks to his new tools, so his sales also increased. Since he received that loan, his family life improved because his income has increased and he is much more able to pay for family expenses. He sends this message to Kiva lenders: "I am very thankful because you allowed me to improve my working conditions with better infrastructure and better tools." 

He is currently applying for another CrediKiva, which he will use to buy car speakers and electric wiring for standard radios. His investment will be successful because he has clients who demand those items.

loans.use: to buy speakers for vehicles and electric wiring for radios

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y siembra de maíz y maicillo, él vive con su esposa y un hijo que ya está casado y tambien tiene un hijo, su ocupación es la de ordeñar el ganado, comercializar la leche, ya sea vendiéndola o elaborando queso y cuajada para la venta.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas que le ofrecen, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar una buena inversión aprovechando la compra para poder a futuro mejorar su ganadería y la producción de leche.
La aspiración de Feliciano es mejorar la ganadería y apoyar a su hijo para que se supere.
texts.en:
Feliciano raises livestock, corn, and maicillo.  He lives with his wife and has a married son who has a son of his own.  His job is to milk the cows and either sell the milk or make cheese to sell.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy two cows.  This loan wkill help him to make this good investment, taking advantage of this so that he can increase his milk production in the future and increase his income.

Feliciano’s aspiration is to improve his livestock business so that he can support his son so that he can succeed.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Wenelina

texts.en: Wenelina is 49 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Her business is selling chocolate in the Philippines. Wenelina has been selling chocolate for five years, and she has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF (Kiva's field partner in the region) to buy more chocolate to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more chocolate to sell.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Benita works hard to support her family. She has a sari-sari (general store) business in the Philippines, and earns additional income by selling fruits and vegetables. Benita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF (Kiva's field partner in the region) to buy products like shampoo and groceries to sell at her store.

Benita has received sustaining support for her business through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy products like shampoo and groceries for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so she can sell the milk.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 49, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Johnny, a cook, and is a mother to her children.  Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Erlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is a place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Php-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erlinda hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Esther sells saucepans, and she is also a seamstress at Akatakyiwa, which she has been for two years. Her husband is a carpenter. Esther uses her income to support her husband and take care of their children. Esther will use the loan to purchase more saucepans and fabrics to sew and sell to enlarge her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and fabrics to sew and sell.

loans.name: Acela

texts.en: Acela is 59 years old and married with three children, and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more more groceries like biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. Acela has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more more groceries like biscuits, soft-drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells local drinks (bisab and lamogii) at Akatakyiwa. Agnes did not go to school. She is married and has four children; her husband is a trader. Agnes has been selling bisab and lamogii since last year. She is responsible for supporting her husband in taking care of their children and other family duties. Her loan will be used to buy more bisab leaves and other ingredients for making bisab and lamogii. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bisab leaves and other ingredients for making local Ghanaian drinks

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
This is Ariel, 21, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he lives with his parents and helps them manage their household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ariel maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts early in the morning and works until late in the evening. There are times when he drives until the wee hours in order to earn a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 PHP in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Ariel hopes to have a good life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit

loans.name: Bashiraan

texts.en:
Ms. Bashiraan is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Bashiraan’s husband. They have been doing it together for the past five years. Bashiraan is a hard-working lady and has three buffaloes to milk. 
She is a mother of six children; three of them are working, while the others are going to school. Bashiraan wants to fulfill the educational expense of her children for their prosperous future. She applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to the Kashf Foundation to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales. She expects to earn profits and desires to spend it on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase sales.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyakimwa  est entrepreneur, doyenne du groupe d’affaire « Neema »,  âgée de plus de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont certains étudient et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Son mari est un cadre d’une entreprise publique douanière « l’Office Congolais de Contrôle (OCC) ». La cliente  est vendeuse  de boissons (Primus, Aigles, Fanta, etc.).  Il ya 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, en 2005, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de Hekima, actuellement, elle a réalisé 21 cycles de crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 10 casiers de Primus, 10 casiers Aigles et  5 casiers de Fanta.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison dans sa propre parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: The client, Kyakimwa is an entrepreneur, the head of the business group "Neema", older than 50, married, and the mother of four children some of whom are students and others have their own homes. Her husband is a manager of a public customs business "l’Office Congolais de Contrôle (OCC)". The client is a drink seller (Primus, Aigles, Fanta, etc.).  She has been doing this for more than 10 years. In 2005, she received her first loan from Hekima, she has gone through 21 credit cycles. This new line of credit will be used to buy 10 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Aigles, and 5 cases of Fanta.  She hopes to send her children to school and build a house on her own land. The client thanks Hekima for their support of poor, unbanked women.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Aigles, and 5 cases of Fanta

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings. With the cooperation of his father, Ali was able to respond to his family needs so they can live a respectable life. 

Ali has owned a mini-market for several years. He has a big variety of products which he sells to customers from his town and the neighboring villages. He’s well known for being kind and friendly with his customers even when they are visiting his shop for the first time. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the required quantity of food provisions for his mini-market. Then he will be able to diversify his inventory and therefore increase his revenue and improve his family’s way of living. 

Ali looks forward to expanding his grocery and collecting the needed savings to be able to get married and have his own family and children.

loans.use: to purchase the required quantity of food provisions for his mini-market

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and four siblings. In 2010, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own work as a farmer. His father is the main income provider, but his income is not enough to cover their heavy life costs. Ali works independently; his job consists in cultivating seasonal fruit. He knows very well how to take care of the trees, especially from one season to another. 

Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required agricultural tools and supplies, a new electric saw and many other items. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage which will give him higher profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase required agricultural tools and supplies, a new electric saw and many other items

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. Like every couple, Kassem and his wife wish to have their own family and children. For this reason, they combine forces to be able live a suitable life, far from problems and complications. 

Kassem opened his own butchery in 2002. He’s a reputable person who always seeks to deliver good, fresh products to his customers. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new tools and equipment for his butchery. Then he will be capable to develop his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and start his own dairy products business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for his butchery

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 44 years old and a resident of Lebanon. He is married to Sabah, the mother of his five children, who are all attending school. Hussein supports his family with pleasure and is ready to help whenever they need it. He has an adorable family, for whom he’s ready to sacrifice his life. 

Hussein has owned a van for the past six years. His job consists of transporting students to their schools. He works independently on a freelance basis. In parallel, he works as a farmer. Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the necessary maintenance on his van. This loan will allow him to perform his job properly. The most important thing is transporting the students safely without facing any problems. Hussein has many ideas for the future to improve his business, and he’s planning to apply these ideas once he has the opportunity.

loans.use: to perform the necessary maintenance on his van

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 30-year-old Lebanese engaged man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. His father is the main source of income and he really cares for their future. Since Georges wishes to get married and, at the same time, help his father with the expenses, he decided to start his own business. He opened his own discotheque in 2009. He diversifies his items in order to please his clients. He also attends some events where he plays a musical instrument. This will be an added source of income for him and his family. Today he intends to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase music CD’s and DVD’s in order to increase the number of products and therefore earn a higher income. In the future, he plans to open a small cinema in his town where he can receive customers from his town and the surroundings.

loans.use: to purchase music CD’s and DVD’s

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. Two of her children attend school and one working. In 2002, she started running her own business selling accessories and Brazilian gold. Her income is really essential to help her husband with the household expenses and to pay her children’s school fees. Her husband works in security in a local company and they cooperate together to meet the needs of life. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her inventory of accessories and gold. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales to amplify her income. In the future, she is planning to open her own shop and diversify her items even more.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of accessories and gold

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 26 years old. He lives in the Khulo District with his wife, father and 3-year-old daughter. 

Zviad requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Zviad, who works locally as a school watchman. Besides, the family grows potatoes on the family-owned agricultural land and sells the harvested products locally. 

According to the government’s estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and gets a relevant pension from the local government.  The monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. It is hardly enough to feed a four-member family. 

Zviad requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country’s rural poor. The rural poor do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Zviad will purchase two milk cows. He will place them in an old empty farm building located in their yard. Zviad will work hard on the farm. He will produce dairy products and sell them in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and start up a dairy farm.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en: Tamaz is 31 years old. He lives with his parents in Sighnaghi District, Kakheti region, East Georgia. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family owns a vineyard and produces wine to sell locally. Additionally, he owns a hectare of agricultural land which needs cultivating, however, the income is not enough for covering the everyday expenses. So, Tamaz decided to start up a new business. He has requested loans from his local financial institutions several times without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of low income and a lack of experience in the new job, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, Tamaz will cultivate a hectare agricultural land and sow cucumbers and peppers which will increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Tamaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate a hectare of land to grow cucumbers and peppers.

loans.name: Saeedan

texts.en:
Ms. Saeedan is a 33-year old married woman. She is very motivated and has always wanted to do something to help improve her family situation. 
Her husband, a driver, had been the sole earner of the family, and it had been difficult to cover all household expenses from his income alone, so Saeedan took initiative and started a clothes retailing business. She purchases clothes in various designs and colors from the market at wholesale prices to sell to people in her community. She knows the tastes of her customers very well.

She is a mother of five, four of whom are attending school currently. She needs to improve her business, so she can use profits to meet the needs of her children. In order to purchase more variety of winter season clothes, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20000. With the new merchandise, she will able to earn increased profits through her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of winter season clothes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty earns a living by selling vegetables and fruits and cooked food to people from her place in Kisauni, Mombasa. She has been in the business for more than ten years now.

Betty is asking for a loan to buy cooking ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasoning, cooking oil and others. With the ingredients funded by this loan she will be able to cook more food to sell.

In the future, Betty hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasoning, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Sénam

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant âgée de 26 ans, Sénam est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique de la place. Elle a débuté en 2009 et sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour se ravitailler en produits alimentaires. Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices supplémentaires pour acheter un terrain ensuite. Elle souhaite agrandir d’avantage son activité et de préparer déjà la venue de ses futurs enfants.
texts.en: Single and with no children at 26 years old, Sénam is a retailer of general foodstuffs in a shop on the square. She began in 2009 and is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to re-stock her supply of foodstuffs. She wants to save her supplementary profits in order to later purchase land. Sénam wishes to further expand her business and to begin to prepare for the arrival of her future children.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is 33 years old. He is married and has one child. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, coffee, and sorghum. They also keep cows and goats.

Baker looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Baker will buy agricultural inputs to increase the productivity of his farm. His biggest dream is to see his children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Ms Marriam is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She faced a lot of hurdles in her married life as her husband is employed in a small factory of manufacturing. It was getting hard for him to bear everyday expenditures of family members alone. Such circumstances compelled Nasreen to initiate business activity to support her family. She is a mother of four. She is putting a lot of effort in contributing family income to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. Her husband is very supportive and assists her by buying stock of goods from the market.

She needs goods of daily use to meet her customers demand time after time. For this she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy stock of rice, flour and grains. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She hopes to get increase in her income by catering more customers. She wishes to utilize the part of profits on providing quality education to her children and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married and lives with her husband and their children. She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. Mupa has been in business for many years and has gained sales experience that allows her to generate more income. Her store is in her home, which is situated in a very busy location. She has many customers who prefer to do business with her because she has quality products at affordable prices and always makes customers her priority. The secret behind her success is her consistency and her love for her work. She knows this is the only way to achieve what she wants.

Like any good merchant, she wants to increase her business by making a new investment. Mupa is in need of capital, so she is requesting a loan from Yehu Microfinance to buy basic grains, snack foods, eggs, bread, beverages, and other products. She has good credit references and is confident that she can repay this loan while providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans, groundnuts and coffee. He also keeps cows, goats and chickens.

Charles looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Charles will save to buy more land. He dreams of improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Manyazi

texts.en:
A reseller of ready-to-wear outfits and shoes since 2009, Manyazi also farms seasonally. She is married, and the mother of two.  Both children are in   school. 

She manages her own business, but does not yet have a fixed location. She is requesting her fourth loan from Yehu Microfinance to buy merchandise. 

She wants to save her profits, and expand her business to better cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and outfits to resell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 23 years old. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans, rice, cassava and sweet potatoes. He also keeps chickens and pigs. 

Charles looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW).  As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Charles will save to buy more land. He dreams of improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 36-year-old married man with 4 children living in Kyenjojo,Uganda.  He has been in the motorcycle and bicycle spare parts business for four years. He has a tea plantation, and also trades in produce for additional income. 

His business is located along a busy street where clients can easily find him.  After realizing that his family was growing and he needed to give them a better standard of living, he decided to venture in a number of businesses as noted above.

Charles is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle and bicycle parts to resell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is requesting a new loan because she needs to buy more stock for her fruit and vegetable selling business. She will buy apples, pears, grapes, potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits that are in demand to continue selling to her customers.

Yehu financial support has had positive effect as it allowed her to keep her business going. With her earnings, she has been able to contribute towards her family's daily food costs. She will continue her sales, and she will also continue supporting her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy apples, pears, grapes, potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits to increase her stock for her business.

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en: Beglar is from the Keda district of West Georgia. He is fifty years old, and lives with his three children and daughter-in-law. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. More specifically, the family owns a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables and fruits are grown. Additionally, they have a cow whose milk is used in cheese production. Beglar and his family do all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are then sold at the local open market. Beglar is a very hard-working man with a lot of experience in this work. Beglar has requested a loan to purchase beehives with bee colonies. This will enable him to produce ecologically clean honey that he can then sell at the local open market. This investment will increase his family's income. With increased income they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 37 years old. He is married and has six children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow bananas, maize, beans and coffee. They also have goats, sheep, chickens and pigs.

Christopher looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Christopher will buy agricultural inputs. He dreams of being able to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a fruit vendor, a business she has been running for over six years. In this business, she sells mangoes, oranges, lemon, melon etc. She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy new stock of fruits. The main challenge she faces is the shortage of stock and the high taxation from government agencies. 

She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She has a plan to educate her children from the additional income that she will obtain from this loan.

loans.use: To buy new stock of fruits.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old. He is married and has one child. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, coffee and bananas. They also have cows, goats and chickens.

Emmanuel looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Emmanuel will save to buy more animals. He dreams of building a secondary school in his village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mndalu

texts.en:
Mndalu is one of the best in his trade. His self-discipline and dedication has taught him that dreams can come true and that no barriers exist apart from those that we limit ourselves with.

His biggest wish is to be able to improve the service in his business and earn some income. Because of this he is asking for a loan so that he can establish a cell phone charging business. With the loan, he wants to purchase battery and cell phone charger for use in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a battery and cell phone charger for use in his business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a fishmonger, and has run her business for one year. Besides this, she also owns a tailoring and a charcoal selling business. Jackline was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit for business operations. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to revamp her tailoring business by buying sewing threads, needles and materials for dress making in preparation for the festive season. She believes the extra income from this business will help her provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy sewing threads, needles and materials for dress making

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim is 36 years old. He is married and has three children. Alim lives in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan with his wife and children, but he was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli the town. Now he needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy calves to improve his business. He loves his work. Alim has been in the agriculture business for two years. He breeds cows.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Ngongo

texts.en:
Ngongo is married and the father of two children, who are still too young for school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a trader who sells broiler chickens. With the current loan, he intends to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines in order to increase his stock.

In the future, he wishes to start a new business in order to increase his monthly income. For that reason, he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so that he can request more loans from Yehu Microfinance.

The challenge he faces is having funds that help him to expand his chicken raising business and to buy other types of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines in order to increase his stock.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is 42 years old. She lives in the Gurjaani District, East Georgia with her brother and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension.  The family has a vineyard and sells grapes locally at a good price. She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success.
